Summary: We stayed at this hotel in October and since it had been years since we visited Disneyland I looked at dozens of hotels in the area.  The location was excellent, short walking distance to parks, several restaurants and shopping mall.  The lobby was beautiful and the rooms were very nice, we were very impressed with this hotel and they price was excellent.  The breakfast was very good, with a large variety of hot foods, cereals and fruit.  The manager Arthur was so pleasant and helpful, he personally goes from table to table in the breakfast room inquiring about your stay and asking if you need anything. We were also able to purchase our park tickets for less than we would if purchased at the parks!  The front desk personnel were professional and helpful. I would recommend this

Summary Heading: Staff friendly, free breakfast, close walk, free parking, microwave and fridge in  room.. Checked off all out boxes!!!
Summary: We arrived early and had to wait a little bit for our room, but ARTHUR  whom I suppose was the Manager made sure that we had everything  we needed to relax while waiting.. Fresh cookies and cartoon for the kids.. After 20 minutes we sent our 5 yr old to the counter to ask if our room was ready and sure enough, it was. The receptionist said she was weak to her cuteness but I'm sure we were just lucky.. The hotel is close to everything you need such as Pizza, Chinese , Mexican food and beer, wine and Souvenirs. Each day we saw ARTHUR and he made sure we were ok and asked if we needed anything. We had a very pleasant experience here and would consider staying again but Disney Ain't cheap .. Oh and the walk wasn't that bad at all . 15 min tops .. to parks . There are closer Hotels

Summary Heading: low price doesn't mean low expectations
Summary: spent 4 nights here, and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Room was clean, staff was very helpful and friendly. The beds were extremely comfortable. I liked the secure underground parking. The free breakfast was phenominal. Not a skimpy doughnut, but a full breakfast with eggs, bacon, hash browns, etc. If you leave hungry, it's your own fault. The hotel is walking distance to Disneyland and close to major highways, making other california attractions easy to get to. A real 5 star hotel in my opinion

Summary Heading: What a great hotel with exceptional staff!
Summary: This was my third trip to Disney, and my first time to this hotel.  If I ever make it back, this is definitely where I will stay.  The only thing I didn't like is that our room faced the back of the plaza next door.  However, the room was clean, roomy, had a free safe, a microwave and a coffeemaker.  The shower had good pressure, the beds were comfortable, and there were plenty of pillows.  It had everything one would need, but the view was really the pits.  Not that we went there for the view though, and it doesn't affect the rating I'm giving this hotel  We were within walking distance to Disneyland.  I had read on the forums that by choosing a hotel 15 minutes away from the parks I would think every time I passed closer hotels that I wished I had stayed there.  And I did.

Summary: Stayed Oct. 21st and 22nd , I am a annual passholder at Disneyland , and visit several times a year , I usually stay at the Tropicana which nice but as with all the hotels across the street from Disneyland you get nickel and dimed for everything from resort fee to parking, so I decided to try someplace different after several days of searching and reading reviews and talking with other passholder friends of mine I decided to try the Ramada Plaza and boy I wasn't disapointed ,I aarived there about 7:am and checked in was given my parking pass by a helpful and pleasant staff , NO CHARGE for parking and no resort fee which was nice me and my friend were deciding where to go for breakfast as the free breakfast buffet is for the first morning after checkin but the manager Arthur came

Summary: First visit to Anahiem for our family, we stayed 7 nights. Could not fault the location. Close to shops, food, rental cars, and Disney, the ART bus to Disney stops out the front door, perfect. The best part of our stay here was the staff. Nothing was to much to ask. Bernado was such a excellent host and helped us to get around to town, go to the baseball, recommend restaurants, arrange transfers you name it (I should have left a bigger tip). We spent 5 weeks in the states and this was a place to feel comfortable and relaxed. The room was tidy and clean, the pool was lots of fun and the breakfast was a great way to start the day. We would have no reservations in staying at the ramada plaza again.

The breakfast was limited and juices very watered down but gave us the nutrients needed for long Disney days. There were burn marks on the floor in my room.  (2) The shower curtain was not wide enough to keep the water from leaking onto the floor when taking a shower. Summary: 10/19-10/21 Took my best friends and her parents (who never travel) to Disneyland & stayed at the Ramada. Hotel was spacious & enough for us 5 to fit comfortably. Staff was friendly especially the manager Arthur. You could tell he was sincere & genuinely a friendly person. I think this was a big part of our stay because every time we went downstairs he greeted us, and made us feel welcomed in his hotel. I think that's important when you can feel less like you're staying somewhere else.   Overall great! Free breakfast buffet & parking garage made it feel safe to leave your car in.   Negatively I would just hire more maids there. Took us extra 30mins to get into our room but it was ok.

My big complaint was the hobos ate a meal and defecated at the corner of the property next to sidewalk ,(see photo). I walked past it on the way to the park and saw a employee of the hotel walk past it too , so I figured she would have reported it as it stank and was next to dining area. that night it was still there so I told Robert at the front desk about it , It remained there for another day before it was cleaned up

Summary: My family and I have been to CA many times and we typically stay in Anaheim and drive to Universal Studios and Sea World.  We usually stay at a different hotel directly across the street from the park for the convenience.  This year our party was smaller with myself and 2 adult children so we changed it up.  This hotel is within walking distance of the park-15 mins or so.  It is also near the Garden Walk Mall with Cheescake Factory, Bubba Gump's, PF Chang's, and a few others.  There is a 7-11 on the other end of the block along with a pizza place, Mexican food, and Subway.  We were there for 15 nights.  I had read the reviews on this property and most were dead on.  The room we were in had trouble with the toilet plugging the first night and that was fixed within 30 minutes.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel, amazing staff and the only place to stay In Disneyland.   area
Summary: We booked the Ramada Plaza, Anaheim from reviews on trip advisor and would now only recommend Ramada Plaza as the place to stay.  We have always stayed at Sheraton Anaheim but are so glad that we followed trip advisor reviews and chose Ramada Plaza.  From the minute we checked In we were treated like family.  We had had a robbery on the Blue Line to Anaheim and were expecting a Police Officer to visit the hotel to take a report.  Every staff member apologized for what had happened and hoped it wouldn't affect the rest of our stay.  They were so genuine in their "Hello" and "Have a nice day".  We walked in a few days later and Robert remembered us by name and handed me a fax that had come in from The Sheriff's Department.   Such care and concern for us was genuinely shown to us.
Manager Response: We are happy to know that your stay was delightful after the incident you had. We are always happy to serve all of our guests in any way possible. We hope that from now on we are the hotel you choose to stay for your future visits.

Summary: We stayed here on our vacation to Disneyland.  The room was nice.  The beds were comfortable.  We could actually see the fireworks from our room window.  My husband and I and our two older daughters (14 and 23) stayed in the room comfortably.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  They would talk with us each day at breakfast and joke with us.  They made our stay feel like we were visiting family.  We really enjoyed our stay and will return when we go back to Disneyland.  There was a shuttle to take you to Disney but we drove each day.  The breakfast was good and included in the price of the room stay.  I would highly recommend this hotel.

Staff was pleasant and helpful, parking is free and they also allowed me to keep my car parked there on the last day even after I had already checked out. I would stay here again.

I nicely informed him of my conversation with the front desk earlier in the day and his response "sorry the people in the room prior did not check out till 2pm (check is 11am) so there is nothing I can do but say sorry then tried to offer me 2 bottles of room temperature water.  Other than that, the walk to Disneyland is about 10

Summary: We stayed in 309. The toilet was funny, we have to open the back every time we flush and put down the rubber water thing or it keeps running. The shower drips water unless you really tighten it, which I can't do, so my boyfriend has to turn it off and on for me. We got an noise complaint to our room for talking and watchingTV.. I understand it was 12 but I can also heard the people next door fighting earlier in the day, loud and clear. I felt bad cuz I could here everything and it was a privet matter. There's a door that joins both rooms and that's the sound problem, not us. Other than that the staff is friendly, rooms are clean and the beds are comfy. Oh and great location to Disneyland!

Summary: We checked in without a reservation as we were unsure if we would stay overnight but this was the hotel we chose based on reviews, location, etc.    We booked a room with a king sized bed for one night.  The front-end staff were excellent, very helpful and attentive.  We bought discounted Disney tickets from the hotel and noticed another place in the area selling them for more.  The tickets were for one day only and were $80 each (versus $87 at the gate).  We were provided with some suggestions for restaurants for dinner and there were numerous within a five minute walk.  It was hard to choose one but we went to Bubba Gumps one night and Roy's the second night.  Very pleased with both.  The breakfast buffet was included and it was great.  Something for everyone with scambled
Manager Response: We are glad you decided to stay with us. As the reviews helped you, we encourage guests to place reviews for other travelers. It’s good to know that our staff was helpful and we thank you for taking the time to place your comments online. Hopefully next time you get to take enjoy out pool.

Summary: Stayed here for four nights with family in September 2012.  We planned a 3 day trip to Disneyland.  Hotel is within walking distance to Disneyland.  There is a shuttle bus that stops right in front of the hotel that takes you directly to Disneyland.  Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and helpful.  Buffet breakfast was very good.  The hotel is also within walking distance to some good restaurants.  Would definitely book this hotel again whenever in the Anaheim area.

Summary Heading: Will only stay here from now on
Summary: I am so pleased with our stay at the Ramada Plaza.  The staff is so helpful and friendly.  The breakfast was great and saved money.  The Indian food is awesome at the restaurant.  It was clean and safe.  The walk to Disneyland is not bad but there is also the option of three shuttles right near the hotel.  The rooms were clean and included a fridge and microwave.  It is also near restaurants and stores for any needs you have.  The price was great for everything you get.  The other thing that is great is there is a locked garage for your car.  I have two more Disneyland trips planned in 2013 and this is where I will stay.
Manager Response: We are grateful for your comment. Happy to hear you enjoyed out breakfast. We will be waiting for your return in 2013.

Summary: We have just returned from a family Disneyland experience travelling as grandparents with our daughter and son in law and 5 children. We required two rooms and wanted to be close to Disneyland. The Ramada satisfied all our needs.  We were given spacious interconnecting rooms, each containing two queen beds, lounge ,desk and flat screen television. The bathroom was spacious and we had a large builtin wardrobe with safe and a unit with fridge,microwave and coffee machine. Temperatures were very high during our stay and the ducted airconditioning was a blessing. The staff were very attentive and we felt it was like a "home away from home". Our housekeeper Raoio went the extra mile by setting up the kids soft toys from Disneyland on their pillows to make it more homely when we

Summary: We stayed here for two nights in September 2012 while visiting Disneyland. We were able to check in early (9:30am) which was great and were able to head right to the parks. Very friendly staff and hotel was generally clean and comfortable. Our room was a handicapped room and we did have problems with it. Bathroom was in poor shape and there was no surfaces to set anything on, not even a toilet seat. Also had very loud air conditioner that kept turning on at night and woke us up. Later when our safe didn't work, we asked for another room and that one was much better: quiet, clean and a perfectly fine bathroom. The free breakfast buffet was good with plenty to eat. Just walk down the road to the parks, which took about 15 minutes from hotel door to gate. Never tried out the pool,

Summary Heading: Great Hotel For Disneyland or Business
Summary: My boyfriend and I were going to Disneyland, so I wanted a hotel where we could park the car and walk to the Park without worry. The Hotel was very clean, very friendly, and SO convenient! The breakfast buffet was really nice, serving pancakes, pineapple or watermelon, sausage, bacon, scrambled eggs, cereal, and had juices/coffee/milk. I saw a few families, and it seemed perfect to have the hotel, breakfast, and walking distance to the park. Also, very professional staff, and we had a few business service needs that were met. I definitely recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a clean safe hotel close to the parks without the huge price!

The complimentary early morning breakfast was also a real hot breakfast with real scrambled eggs, bacon, and sausage, etc.    (Some other hotels that I stayed in the past would offer continental breakfast that consisted of a few dried breads, cereal & hardened bagels.. That is not so with this hotel.)  I would say that the only drawback to this hotel is that it is about 8-10 minute walk to Disneyland & the California Adventure. The free breakfast was great. The hotel is near Disneyland and many resturants. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends and family. I cant wait to come back again!

Summary: my husband and i went to anaheim for our 3rd year anniversary sept1 2012 the staff we so friendly and helpful.they googled me all my directions for everywhere we went as my gps wasn;t working.they were so professional and fast. this hotel is so clean and the beds are so comfortable also the hotel is such a great location we could walk to every restaurant we ate at.our first week here was so fun we booked back into this hotel for our second week coming back from las vegas.the whole staff even made us a nice poster for our anniversary and gave water to us with fresh baked cookies.they made us feel like a part of their family this is the only hotel we will ever stay at.Looking forward to coming back.Also you get free breakfast every day saves us a lot of money.

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable, walking distance to Disneyland, excellent front desk staff, free parking, breakfast, and welcome cookies.
Summary: We booked our hotel for labor day weekend and stayed here with our two kids, one infant and one toddler. When we checked in, we asked the front desk guy if we could have a room where it's a little more quite so our baby can sleep better through the night. He informed us it's a full house already since it's labor day weekend. Check-in was quick, less than 5min. We got up to our room and started putting our babies milk and food in the fridge. We noticed it wasn't that cold so we told the front desk. They came up right away to check and had our fridge switched out immediately! Wow, that is superb customer service! I wish they had a small freezer compartment in the fridge though because we needed our ice pak to keep the milk cold while we go to the amusement parks. They also brought

Summary: We've been staying at the Ramada Plaza for our frequent trips to Disneyland over the past two years, and wouldn't think of staying anywhere else! The staff is great, very warm and friendly, the rates are terrific, and the rooms are very, very nice.

Summary: We recently stayed at the Ramada Plaza Hotel in Anaheim for 4 nights while visiting Disneyland, Universal Studios, and the beach from Utah.  We chose this Hotel after reading good reviews and considering the offered amenities.  All six of us were not disappointed!  We arrived early at the Hotel (8:30 am) and the Ramada staff lived up to the reviews!  They were very courteous and allowed us to check in early, which was painless and straight forward.  I can definitely say the friendliness and personal level of service was great!  We got to our room which was very spacious, clean and nice. It had two queen beds and a sofa with a pull-out bed. The location to Disneyland where the race started was ideal. We walked to the start line and walked back after the race. What made this weekend stay at the Ramada so memorable was the enthusiastic staff that works for this hotel. We were greeted by fun, happy, interested in what you were doing and such helpful staff members.  The breakfast was included in our stay, and when we returned from the run and went into the breakfast area, the restaurant manager ran to get us a voucher so we didn't have to go up to our room to get the one we received at check in.  it was a very clean and very welcoming hotel. Firstly the location is excellent.  Is about a 10 minute walk to the Disneyland front entrance which was a pretty good way to start the day - you can get a shuttle bus for a small fee (Disneyland car park is over the road from Ramada), however was only a very small walk.  On the other side, just a short walk was plenty of nice restaraunts (Cheesecake Factory & Bubba Gump my favorites, however plenty of others), so well positioned to both areas. The check in was painless and straight forward.  We got to our room which was very spacious, clean and nice.  We had 2 queen beds and a sofa with a pull-out bed.  The A/C was a life saver as it was very humid and warm this week.  The room was great with HDTV and free wifi internet.  The refrigerator was nice and large to accommodate water and milk bottles.  The microwave was essential.  The bathroom was adequate and clean.    The free breakfast was good. Summary: We stayed here for 9 nights and would return without hesitation. The hotel is excellently situated for Disney less than 15 mins walk or you could get a bus from the nearby bus stop. There are food outlets nearby and a 7-11 convenience store on the way to Disney. The staff are all really helpful and polite. The lobby lounge has coffee at all times. Everywhere is spotless, the rooms are spacious with full size fridge and microwave. Beds are really comfortable and the bathroom is large and clean with load of towels. The ceiling tiles are a bit stained but not dirty. The pool is a little small but private with a hot tub and a seating area and shower and there is a sauna indoors but you won't need it this time of year! Manager Response: It was a pleasure welcoming you as our guest. Thank you for the detail review. Hope to see you again.

Summary: We stayed at the ramada for 4 nights, check in was really fast, the staff were very helpfull. The ramada is central to everything, disneyland restraunts and shopping centers also they provide free shuttles to further out shopping centres. For low price and high quality i would highly recommed to anyone!!
Manager Response: We are pleased to know that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your review.

Summary Heading: Good staff, average rooms, and right amenities.
Summary: Good stay over all the staff really outshined the hotel itself.  The only thing that really bugged is the guy running the vacuum in the dinning room after breakfast. I realized it was after 10 AM however take away the food and let the families lounge. Everyone shalled out big money for a vacation, to have the last day blasted by the sound of a industrial vacuum cleaner while recapping the previous days events, may not be the the last thing you want them to remember.
Manager Response: We are very happy that you enjoyed your stay with us. I do apologized on behave of the breakfast staff for the vacuuming while you were enjoying your breakfast. Thank you for taking the time to comment on your stay.

Summary: We stayed here for 10 days and the staff couldn't have been nicer.  We felt like the staff was family.  They always greeted us by name and talked with us.  It's a short bus ride or walk to Disneyland.  We had a room facing Disneyland and the room was very large.  We would stay there again. Also very close walking distance to many eating places. Free full hot breakfast, free water anytime you asked.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback. We like to know our guests and their experience of their stay while they are in our hotel. We are always happy to serve our guests. We hope you stay with us on your next visit to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Short walk to Disneyland, clean rooms, free parking, free wifi, free continental breakfast!
Summary: We only stayed one night in July but so glad we did.  The hotel is conveniently located across the street from Disneyland with lots of eating places nearby.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  They allowed us to park in the lot before checking in so we didn't have to pay for parking at Disneyland.  The room was clean and beds were comfortable.  Sad we didn't have enough time to swim at the pool.  Looked like fun!  The continental breakfast was great to grab and go before heading to Disneyland.  We will definitely stay here on our next trip to Disney!

Summary: We stayed at the Ramada Plaza for seven nights on 24th – 31st August 2012 and found it to be a good choice. The room was nice with two large beds. It was equipped with a large fridge and a microwave. There was good coffee making facilities in the room. The room was very clean and the beds were clean and comfortable but the décor was starting to look a little dated. Staff were helpful and friendly especially the breakfast staff. Complimentary breakfast was included. This was a cooked breakfast where you could help yourself. The hotel main areas were nice and well kept. We used the outdoor pool on one afternoon. We were able to walk to both locations, however a shuttle stop is available nearby. I liked the underground parking for keeping the car cooler in the hot part of the day.  The room was larger than anything I expected, with two queen beds plus a fold out couch/sitting area with full desk. There was a small fridge and microwave as well. I found it extremely clean and comfortable for the 5 night stay. The hotel has internal hallways that we found relatively quiet and very safe.  Our rate included a daily breakfast buffet. Summary: We stayed here for 6 nights in July.  Overall, we enjoyed our stay.  The reception staff were welcoming, polite and very helpful.  Our room had 2 queen beds with sofa bed and was plenty roomy enough for our family of 4.  The room and bathroom were spotlessly clean.  The main reasons we chose to stay here were free parking, free wi-fi, free breakfast and the room had a fridge and safe.  The parking was underground and this proved a blessing when the weather was hot.  We didn't use the pool but it looked rather small.  The free breakfast was very basic with little choice, juices were not fresh but reconstituted but it was included and filled us up for a day in the parks. The Ramada is a 10 minute walk to Disney's main gates.  There are plenty of restaurants and shops nearby.  The

Summary Heading: Really wanted to like it, but it was just sub-average
Summary: The good: 15 min walk to Disney parks, free parking, good price, clean rooms, helpful staff. The bad:  1. Internet access was really bad, even after requesting help from the reception desk. Even after being provided a private vpn connection, nothing worked. I guess this wouldn't bother most people coming exclusively for a Disney vacation, but this wasn't our case.  2. Breakfast was of questionable quality and two of our kids got food poisoning during our stay. The breakfast is dubbed "All American buffet," but it's fat and cholesterol laden. The apple juice is watered down and tastes bad; the pancakes are the package variety and overcooked; the scrambled eggs, sausages and bacon looked greasy; there was no fresh fruit and the coffee had a questionable taste. The breakfast area
Manager Response: Thank you so much for letting us know about your experience at our hotel.  We value your opinion and appreciate the time our guests take to write reviews about our facility as it helps us improve. It is unfortunate to hear about your experiences with the internet, breakfast and the uncomfortable temperature on the first floor.  Shortcomings are inexcusable however during the summer with such high occupancy the facility suffered some wear and tear. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Great for Family Trip to Disney
Summary: We recently spent eight days here while doing Disney and found it ideal for our needs. We had two adjoining rooms that each had two beds and a sleeper sofa. Both rooms were clean and the beds were firm but comfortable. My college age boys report that the sleeper sofa beds were ok. The staff was polite and helpful at all times. It was very convenient to start each day with an adequate free breakfast before heading over to the parks. It's not plush, but a buffet line of scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage links,hash browns, pancakes, cereal,toast, fresh fruit, juices, coffee and milk really helped our budget since we were traveling with five teens/college students. Free parking was also nice. It's a short ten-minute walk over to the Disney parks, and there are also several eating

Summary Heading: Is the Ramada Plaza the Best in Anaheim?
Summary: Ramada Plaza Hotel really has everything you need. We stayed for 6 days and loved it. They have - Free parking! Free excellent full All-American breakfast! The room has a refrigerator,  coffee maker and a microwave! And the Internet is FREE! The shower curtain is also very special. It is curved and gives you a lot more room when standing taking a shower!!!   The Ramada Plaza is in a great location just a few blocks from Disneyland and the convention center, so we just walked back and forth to Disneyland the two days that we went there....  Not only was the service great at the front counter but also with the person who made up our room each day. They fold all the towels so cute and make everything very neat and tidy every day! Not only do they clean very well but even when I
Manager Response: Thank you so much for choosing to stay at Ramada Plaza and for your detail comments. We look forward to hosting you in the future.

Summary: We've chosen this hotel due to the proximity to the Disney Parks and to the good reviews here on TA. Our experience was terrible. The toilet flush of our room (419) didn't work and although we complained for 2 consecutive days (of the 3 we'd stay in the hotel) by phone, directly at front desk, to the manager and etc, the problem was not solved. So for two days our family (with 2 kids) had to use the restroom of the lobby!!!! (OMG). On the 3rd night they decided to change our room (to the 402, a larger one with a sofa). But we found a little surprise in the toilet (again!! see the photo attached). At check-out we had to ask for a discount at the front desk and they gave a 30%off in the first 2 nights. The breakfast area is disgusting and poor quality of food.  A room without a TV
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review and for letting us know about your recent visit to our hotel.  We regret to hear that our facilities failed to meet your expectations and we have taken the steps necessary to correct the problems you encountered.  We greatly appreciate the feedback and take our guests suggestions and concerns seriously.  Guest satisfaction is always our number one priority

Summary: Ok the good points: location for Disney, breakfast, swimming pool and the Indian restaurant.  The bad: poor Internet service, torn linen and problems with the washroom - a faulty cistern which would flush continuously and a bathroom extractor that did not work. Both issues were raised several times with the lobby desk but unfortunately without a permanent solution.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  We appreciate you taking the time to comment about your stay with us. We sincerely apologize for the shortcomings you encountered.  Inconveniences like such are not ever excusable.  However we have addressed the issues you listed above so they are not recurring.  If you ever visit the Disneyland Resort again, we would love the opportunity to serve you and have you as a guest again.

Summary: Stayed for 6 nights based on reviews from others online and have to say that they were pretty accurate. The hotel was a 5-7 minute walk away from the Disneyland gates... we could even see the Tower of Terror at California adventures from our hotel window across the street. The hotel was average and clean. The beds were very comfortable which is great when traveling. And they are one of the few hotels in the area that had free parking. There's a fridge and microwave in the room which was very handy and several restaurants and fast food places near by. The front desk staff was very helpful and polite. The only complaint I would have is that the free breakfast was disappointing. It did include many options of scrambled eggs, beacon, sausage, pancakes, etc. as the reviews indicated

Summary Heading: Very good location, rooms would need to be updated
Summary: We stayed for two nights at this hotel because we wanted to be close to Disneyland. The hotel is very well located and close to lot's of restaurants. The staff was very kind and caring. We had the chance to buy our tickets at the counter for a discount.  Another good thing about this hotel is the breakfast which was a good way to start the day with all the food you need.  About the rooms, I would say that it was just average (that is why I gave an overall rating of 3/5 instead of 4). It was a bit on the small side (I was expecting larger suites) and the overall look was not so good: old carpet and furniture, ok beds, ...  But for the price we paid, I can say that this was still a good deal and I would probably stay there again.

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay for families for a great value!
Summary: My family and I have been coming to Disneyland every year for the past 8 years, sometimes even twice a year.  With 2 kids we always want the comfort and space and main priority cleanliness of a hotel.  We also look for great value and Ramada Plaza covered it all.  We stayed her for 5 nights.  We saved money by staying at a hotel that offers a free breakfast buffet so we can hurry and eat and head to Disneyland.  We save money with the free parking and walking one block to Disneyland.  The staff was awesome and we loved the fresh baked Otis Spunkmeyer cookies!  Our room faced exactly where the fireworks display was so it was perfect for the one night we stayed in.  The only downer was the pool was not available the first day there and they offered us a key to use the pool next

Summary: We stayed here 2 nights.  Arrived very late (12am) after a long flight from the east coast and needless to say, very tired.  Walked right in and was in the room in about 15 minutes.  Quick check in and easy parking.  The room was clean and quiet.  The bathroom left a lot to be desired.  It was clean, but very cold feeling.  The towels were thin and rough and there wasn't any space to place your belongings when getting ready.  The free parking and free breakfast made up for what was lacking in the bathroom. The breakfast was a great buffet, eggs, bacon, sausage and hashbrowns, along with cereal, fruit and drinks.  The location was great, about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland Resort.  Would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great value, very close to Disneyland.
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights a few weeks ago, we found the rooms to be very clean, quiet and the breakfast in the morning was good. A 10 minute walk to Disneyland around the corner, very handy hotel to stay in at very reasonable rates. A good place to stay if visiting Disneyland.

Summary: This is my second stay in Anaheim to visit the parks and I must admit this place is nicer than the first place I stayed at. Which is why I say it's quite nice for Anaheim as it doesn't have that dingy feel that many of the roadside motels within walking distance to the parks tend to have. However, if I was comparing it to accomodation in a variety of areas I'd say it's pretty average. The lobby is nice, and the staff are friendly, but the buffet breakfast was the worst I've had in the USA. There was barely any choice and it was quite bland tasting. Overall a reasonable value stay though.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing Ramada Plaza as your hotel destination.   We are glad to hear you were pleased with our facility despite you not being satisfied with our breakfast. And we hope you consider staying with us the next time you visit the Disneyland Resort as we are improving our breakfast selections.  Customer service and satisfaction is our priority and we greatly appreciate your feedback

Summary: it is a short walk away from disneyland and there are cheap places to eat right next door .Breakfast is ok and the rooms are an excellant size.The best aspect of this hotel is how knowledgeable the front desk staff are about what to see and where to stand when you go to see the light show at disneyland.We ate in the Indian resturant and the food was excellant and there was lots of it.We would definately stay there again

We were able to buy discounted tickets to Disneyland which was an unexpected bonus. The rooms are spacious and well presented. Couldn't fault this place at all.

Summary: Yes, like all Disney purpose hotel, a good night sleep is all you can expect. This you will get at the Ramada Plaza-Good size clean and quiet room,convenient location and helpful,friendly staff.The other plus is the washing machine/dryer facility for overseas travellers who has been on the road like us. With the choice of restaurants a few steps down the road at Garden Walk and Disney main gate 10-15 minutes walk away,the location is ideal.The major downfall is the breakfast,a little effort will go a long way.We found the cereal was stale and the toaster is not enough to service the crowd they get every morning.Fresh fruits??? Banana and watermelon.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay and close to Disneyland
Summary: We spend 5 nights in this hotel and it was a great place to stay. It's just 2 blocks away from Disneyland or you can take the ART shuttle directly in front of the hotel.  This hotel offers free breakfast which is good but it's boring if you are staying for long ,since you get the same food every day.   The room was good and the bathroom was clean and neat. We will come back again to this hotel if we are planning a trip to Anaheim again.

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel the last 3 times we visited Disneyland.  It has always been a good experience.  The rooms are clean.  The hotel is quiet.  It's a convenient walk to Disney.  Parking is free.  The only negative I would say is the breakfast.  The hotel offers a free breakfast at the onsite restaurant.  The restaurant is always crowded and not well stocked.  It's also not the best food.  This last visit we skipped breakfast there and picked up some granola bars at the 7-11.  We will be back should we visit the area again.

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay. From the moment we arrived, the staff were friendly, the lobby immaculate. The room was large, clean and comfortable. the internet access was a little slow during "peak" times, but it was ok.  The included breakfast was excellent. We had take out from the Indian restaurant next to the lobby. Nice and close to convenience stores, and being the Disney precinct, the area is clean and safe.  Less than a 15 minute walk to the front gate of Disney. A really good budget option for a trip to Disney if you don't want to shell out $500+ a night for the Disney resorts.

Summary: We stayed in the Ramada Plaza on 515 West Katella in Oct 2011. I booked based on reviews and was not at all disappointed. I travelled with 3 of my sisters, their spouses/kids and my kids and grandkids. We had 3 Nurses and 2 Firefighters in the crowd. All of us were happy, from cleanliness to safety (firefighters always pay attention to safety details). We were a large group, 21 of us and had 6 rooms.  Upon entry the rooms looked just like they did on the web site. The beds were really comfortable but were more like double beds. The whole room was well done. There was a fridge and a microwave which we found useful as well. Housekeeping did a good job and were always friendly. One of my sisters used to work in housekeeping at a hospital so she took a wet facecloth, wiped the

Summary Heading: Great value, good location, comfy stay.
Summary: Recently stayed here while attending a conference at the convention center, which is about a 5-10 minute walk away. Also very close to Disneyland, restaurants, conveniences, etc. Staff was welcoming and attentive. Room was surprisingly large, had an iron/board, microwave, fridge (which was quiet), and mini coffee maker. Windows (mine facing the busy street) was double paned, but still openable. Nice to have fresh air but when closed shut out all the noise. Free covered parking, invaluable! Free breakfast was average but adequate. Overall, a great value and a comfortable stay.

We specially like the location as it is close to restaurants, mini marts and Disneyland. The Hotel is clean and kept up to date.

Summary: Recently stayed for 3 nights with several family members in three rooms.  All of the staff was ready to assist, always polite and wanted to make sure our vacation was a good experience.  Special kudo's to Edna, who made sure the Disney shuttle would arrive with a wheelchair lift.  She spent the time to make sure it was arranged and asked the next day if all want well.  A really pleasant experience from the check-in to departure.  Breakfast not bad either.  Thanks to one and all.

Summary: Traveling with 4 kids under age 8, hotel was very clean and staff was super friendly. Breakfast buffet in the lobby restaurant was far better than the typical waffle iron/yogurt/hard boiled egg variety offered at many other hotels. Paid a great rate for 3 nights in a terrific hotel. Great access to Disney and Angels, We'll choose this one next time, too!
Manager Response: We are really happy that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for taking the time to post a comment and we will be expecting you back on your next trip.

Summary Heading: Great value in the middle of all the Anaheim area attractions
Summary: Nice hotel near all attractions in Anaheim. Had a reunion of sorts in Anaheim and bunch of us stayed in area hotels. I ended up at 2 different Ramada's in the area. I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with my boyfriend and it was pretty nice.  Great location. It's right by Disneyland, walking distance to the Garden Walk with restaurants and bars. There's even a great Indian restaurant right in the hotel.   We found the hotel easy from the highway and there was amble parking in the garage. The lobby was big and nice. The staff was great, very friendly and informative. Cute little pool and hot tub outside.  I was a little apprehensive since on road trips I've seen a lot of Ramada hotels. This is by far the nicest one I've stayed at.   The room was decent sized. Big comfy clean

Summary: We have stayed in multiple accommodations in Anaheim and this is by far the best accommodation of them all for multiple reasons. Rooms - Very clean, free wifi internet, coffee/tea faciilites, fridge and microwave Location - Very central, just walk downstairs and take a right out the building and you have multiple food places including, subway, pizza, burger place and asian food.  Take a left out the building and you have garden walk which consists of some great shopping and a couple of businesses on you have bubba gumps and the cheesecake factory. Parking - Free parking underneath the building, which is extremely clean to the point that on our first stay they were scrubbing the concrete by hand and then painting all the lines for the parking. Reception - I have never met more

Summary Heading: DO Not look anywhere else. simply outstanding and best bang for your bucks.
Summary: i stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. this is simply the best ramada i ever stayed. check in process was efficient and as wyndham reward member they provided me with 2 bottled water and some delicious cookies. room size is excellent and equipped with free wifi and flat screen hdtv. breakfast was slightly disappointing but at least it was a hot breakfast. i had internet problem on 2nd day of my stay. the router must be reset every 15 min but the night shift front desk was extremely helpful and apologetic even though i literally called him every 5-10 mins asking modem to be reset. and if was at 2am to 3 am. bed was comfortable enough with nice plush pillows. location wise is excellent, 10 mins walk to disney park and half block to octa bus stop at katella-harbor leslie, karen and
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review, we look forward to have you with us on your next trip.

Summary: We were dissapointed in our original lodgings so switched to the Ramada Plaza and are very pleased we did. From the friendly staff to the very clean and comfortable rooms and facilities we were very impressed. The central location close to restaurants and the short walk to Disney made this hotel our choice for future visits . Well done

Summary: Everything from the location, to the staff, to the room were just perfect.  The staff was always very courteous and helpful whenever we approached them at the desk.  We have stayed at this place before, but it seems to get better every time we stay there.    We were there for an event at Convention Center, so the location was important to us.  Also very close to Disneyland.  Both within walking distance.  You literally just walk across the street and you're there.  The free breakfast, which we really enjoyed, is just icing on the cake.  Like I said before, the only way to describe our experience is PERFECT!
Manager Response: I am so delighted to hear you and your family had a great time at our property. we look forward to be part of your vacations the next time around. see you real soon....we hope!!

Summary: The staff could not have been more helpful with anything asked of them.The front desk personnel were so accommodating with any request given to them and all done with a smile.  Special thanks to Arthur who was very knowledgeable about the area and transport options.   The rooms were spacious and clean. Happy to move us when we encountered noisy neighbours. The Breakfast was good but a few more varieties of fruit would have been nice. The Hotel is within walking distance of all good chain restaurants and takeaways options. Disneyland was only 10mins walking distance from the Hotel.  Would recommend this hotel to anyone who is thinking about a trip to Anaheim. Fantastic service and friendly staff as it should be in the happiest place in the world.

Summary: Overall, a pretty good experience. When I first got there with my family, the room we were first given had a flooded bathroom so we got another room painlessly. We got a double queen and sofa bed and the queens were pretty comfortable plus the room looks neat and clean. The staff also was very helpful and friendly. Distance from Disneyland was a manageable 10 minute walk. Breakfast was sausage, bacon, hash brown, scrambled eggs and I think there was pancakes.Will be coming back if there is a chance to.

Summary Heading: Disneyland trip with lots of kids.
Summary: Loved this hotel, I went with 6 kids age 14 years - 16months we rented a 2 queen with sofa sleeper.   Super close to Disneyland (about a ten minute walk) The hotel was extremely clean and the staff was exceptionally polite and helpful. They gave us great directions to every place we wanted to go, there's tons of restaurants next to the hotel and shopping. We had an orange juice accident on the bed late at night and they were there with clean linens within 10 minutes. The free breakfast was ok, pretty standard for a continental, eggs, sausage, hashbrowns, bacon and pancakes they were never empty either. The juice was pretty watered down. The pool was nice and the hot tub was lovely after a long day at Disneyland the only complaint was that we couldn't stay longer. We would
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback. We are happy to know that our staff was able to help you with what it was needed. We will continue to improve our breakfast options to satisfy the needs of our guests. We hope your next stay is a little longer.

Summary: This is very nice and clean hotel.  Free breakfast is good - eggs, sausage, pancakes, fruit, cereal, toasts, etc.  Walking distance to Disneyland & CA Adventures - about 10 minutes.  The only problem - if you plan to sleep on the sleeper sofa - prepare to the painful night - the mattress was really bad - hard and springy. All other beds are perfect.

We appreciate your comments and use them as a way to improve so that we may provide a service that exceeds guest expectations. We apologize that you found the sofa couch uncomfortable.  While some people don't mind the sofa couch, there are those that prefer a bed mattress. We are pleased to hear that your stay overall was an enjoyable one and we look forward to hosting your next stay in the Anaheim Resort area. Sincerely,  Management Ramada Plaza Anaheim “Best of Ramada Award” – 2013, 2012, 2011, 2010, 2006, 2005, 2003

Summary: The key criteria for my stay was to fit myself and my two kids comfortably, each with our own bed.  The Ramada had a room option with two queens and a pull-out sofa.  This worked perfectly. However, it wasn't one of the better experienced I've had at a hotel. Paper cups instead of glasses in the room, a wall/window cooler/heater unit that didn't work well, key cards that didn't work well, and the worst part - no fan/vent in the bathroom... just try and take three showers and use the mirror after each with no ventilation to combat the steam! I was also disappointed that there was no DVD player in the room, but it's not like they advertised one. This was definitely a no-frills stay. On the plus side, it's not a long walk to either Disneyland or numerous restaurants.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments on Trip Advisor regarding your stay with us at the Ramada Plaza Anaheim. Summary: Nice, decent hotel that's walking distance from Disneyland. Very friendly staff, good breakfast and clean room. We were given a junior suite and it's really roomy with a sofa bed and 2 bathrooms, which is really convenient.
Manager Response: We are very happy to hear you enjoyed staying in our recently remodeled junior suite. Thank you for reviewing  our hotel.

Summary: Friendly staff, breakfast was good, we had the two queens and sofa bed. The sofa was uncomfortable but there were plenty of pillows. The room was kind of small for 6 people but we didn't spend much time in it anyway. We would stay here again.
Manager Response: We appreciate your review. We are pleased to know you enjoyed your stay here with us despite the discomfort with the sofa bed.  We will continue to make improvements where is necessary.

Summary Heading: Great stay in Orange County!!!! Very clean room!!!!
Summary: I was very impressed with this hotel & the staff. Relatively close to Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance. The hotel staff was friendly & helpful, you can tell the employees (housekeeping, front desk, etc..) take great pride in their jobs at this location. John Wayne Airport only 20 minutes away (low traffic times). The hotel is about a half mile west of interstate 5. The bed was very comfortable, the room & bathroom was CLEAN. I had a car rental so the parking was very convenient & free for hotel guest. Without hesitation, I would stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent visit. The staff does take pride on making our guest comfortable and happy with our service. We hope to you see you back soon.

Summary: We stayed here for to use our Disneyland Annual Passes one more time before they expired. Very convenient location (10 - 15 minute walk from the entrance of Disneyland), very clean and the front desk was very helpful. Free breakfast (eggs, hashbrowns, bacon, sausage, pancakes and bread) and the best part is that they offer free parking. Some of the other hotels tried to rip us off with parking and one hotel made us move our car after check-out to the Disneyland lot. We don't have kids so we booked a king room and it was very spacious and clean (the room had a fridge, microwave and free wifi). We gave this hotel high reviews because we have stayed at other hotels near the park and the service, staff and room was top notch.
Manager Response: We are glad to know that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your positive input, and we hope that you continue to stay with us on your next visit to Anaheim

Summary: Let me preface this review by stating that, if you're looking for a luxury resort with all the bells and whistles, this isn't it!  This is a mid range, family style hotel with a comfortable feel.  What sets this hotel apart, even from it's more luxurious competitors is it's cleanliness.  IT IS CLEAN, CLEAN, CLEAN.  The hotel is spotless from it reception, to the halls to the rooms themselves.  The day we arrived, the staff were mopping the driveway!  Did we say it was clean people?  We arrived at the hotel at 7.30 a.m. following a long overnight flight from Australia.  We were ushered immediately to our room, despite the scheduled check in time of 2.00 p.m. - very much apprelciated.  We expected our room to be noisy, given that the hotel is on a main thoroughfare but, thanks to

Summary Heading: Next time, skipping the Ramada for Disney.
Summary: I stayed at the Ramada Plaza with my husband & kids for a quick trip to Disneyland - we paid $120 power night for a room that came with 2 queen beds and a pull out couch which is great for family needing a third bed but not wanting to shell out extra cash for a suite.  The room came with a decent bathroom, fridge and microwave, & decent storage space. The 1 major catch and my primary reason for not giving the hotel a good score was the pool. Or should I say lack thereof?  When you're traveling with older children in southern California, it's really important that a hotel have a decent pool and hot tub - the photos on Ramada's website were kind of misleading and the pool was a huge disappointment.  The water was so cold that we couldn't swim in the pool and the hot tub wasn't

Summary: Stayed here over President's Day Weekend for a Disneyland trip. Very convenient location as it is walking distance to Disneyland and also the Garden Walk that has a bunch of restaurants (Cheesecake Factory, CPK, PF Changs, Bubba Gumps, Roy's, McCormick and Shmick's, etc). Stayed in a two queen bed room for 4 people. They also have rooms that can accomodate up to 6 people. Clean hotel, the housekeeping ladies keep it very clean - thanks Lupita! Nice big and new Samsung TVs.   What I really liked is that there was a microwave and fridge for free to use.   Free breakfast with every night's stay was just ok. They had fruit, cereal, toast, english muffins, eggs, bacon, sausage, grits, pancakes, hashbrowns. Only complaint here is that their juice is TOTALLY watered down. Their apple

Summary: I stayed here for the TinkerBell Half Marathon run, the location was perfect just a few blocks away from Disney Hotels. The rooms were nice and the beds are VERY comfy. The hotel was walking distance to mall and great restaurants. They also offered free complimentary breakfast.....eggs, waffles, fruit etc. Hotel staff were very friendly, we enjoyed our stay.

Summary: One of the better hotels I stayed at on a Disneyland Vacation, Being a broke college student, i was offered a amazing price for a 2 night stay when I called in and the operator was amazing! she knew exactly what she was doing and quite helpful. When I got to the hotel around 10am, Usual check in time is 3 but they told me I was able to check in once I got into the hotel. Room was very clean, much space, comfty beds, Only 2 blocks from Disneyland with a plaza right outside and a 7/11 across the street. a delicious all you can eat buffet for breakfast for free. Great Front Desk  AMAZING BUT THE DARN TOILET WAS NOT FUNCTIONING 100% but no matter i WILL definitely be back I usually never do hotel reviews or  the surveys they send you after but I filled that out too.
Manager Response: Dear Guest: I am absolutely delighted that you enjoyed your stay, with us. I do apologize for the toilet malfunction, situation that  we will work to rectify . Can't wait to have you back in our hotel. J.C. Gil Supervisor

Summary: We stayed at the Ramada when we flew into LA, wanted somewhere close to Disneyland.  The room was fantastic, very modern and clean.  Beds were very comfortable.  Staff were so friendly, the reception desk phoned our room to ensure everything was ok.  The view was nothing fancy, just of the carpark....but who cares, we only wanted a room for the night as we were heading off on our big drive around the west coast.   The Ramada offered complimentary hot breakfast which was great - plenty to choose, from waffles, bacon, eggs, cereal etc.  Laundry facilities were very clean, there is however, only two washing machines and two dryers but there never seemed to be a wait for one.  Close location to Disneyland and Avis car hire (one of the reasons we originaly chose this hotel).  We

Summary Heading: Convenient Location with No Hidden Charges
Summary: We stayed in the 2Q 1sofa room for 6 nights and got a good discount for staying more than 5 nights.  Pros Good value for money. Unlike some of the nearby resorts, there are no hidden charges like parking fees, resort fees etc. Within walking distance to Disneyland. There is a ABC mart and a 7 Eleven across the road. There are many eateries/restaurants catering to different budget nearby. The efficient front desk staff responded promptly to choked toilet problem, ran to the motel next door to get me quarters and got me washing detergent from the laundry room when the vending machine was jammed.  Cons The only con is the hot breakfast included in the stay. The food served is decent but it’s surprising that they serve the same items every day with no variation at all.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, i am sorry it might have been somewhat spoiled by your experience at the restaurant, i have spoken to the owner about your concern and how we could improve the quality of our service we hope to see you again soon J.C. Gil Front Desk Supervisor

Summary: Stayed for 10 nights in 2 adjoining rooms and overall this is OK.  Room is quite comfortable but our overall experience was spoiled by a problematic toilet, The toilet blocked on 4 occasions and the staff were responsive EXCEPT on the last occasion when we were handed the plunger and advised to fix it ourselves.   Upon complaining to Karen (Manager) she apologised and offered us a room change - a bit late for this. When advised that we would be writing a letter of complaint, Karen didn't seem overly concerned.  Apart from that - breakfast is OK but very limited and we stopped having it after 7 days. It does get crowded and run out towards the latter part.  The walk to Disney was 12 minutes (timed) so is convenient and there are a number of eateries around this hotel.  Overall -
Manager Response: I would like to offer my most sincere apologies ,we are currently working on the issue you mentioned about the plumbing, to assure that this will not happen again. Hopefully you will reconsider staying with us in the future; we will be delighted to have you and your family staying with us.  J.C. Gil Front Desk Supervisor

Summary Heading: Best Holiday Ever w/Thanks to Ramada Plaza!
Summary: Disneyland ~ Best Holiday Ever ~ & knowing that we head back to the Ramada Plaza each night, made it the complete package!  Beautiful Hotel, Great Price, Amazing, Friendly Staff ~ there to handle any/all questions, issues, concerns.  They stepped to the plate each time & couldn't be more courteous & willing to accommodate anything that we'd like.   Super clean rooms, comfy beds, flat screen tvs, all amenities, pool, hot tub, 24 hr. wash/dry laundry, gym, parking, ice machine, shuttle p/u ~ they mop the parking lot daily!  The night concierge even found us batteries when our laptop mouse needed new ones!  The Breakfast Buffet is Delightful ~ staff is over the top friendly & helpful.  Brought my young son Apple Juice, even when the buffet menu had cranberry & orange juice

Summary: We stayed here for our Disney vaca. My family and I enjoyed staying here. Clean, comfortable beds, free buffet breakfast. For a family of a four a great savings! Only one thing about the breakfast. There was a hostess that greeted us very nice but, unprofessionally dressed white shirt black bra. Felt like I was eating at hooters but even they are dressed a little better. My 9 yr old daughter asked why would she wear that if you can clearly ser her bra, if my little one knows you would think this  young lady would. Overall though, I do recommend this hotel.

Summary: We stayed for 6 nights, and were quite happy while there. We had a small problem with our room, but the desk staff were very accommodating to move us to a bigger room at no charge. They were also very courteous and helpful throughout our stay. The beds were very comfortable, room was big and clean. Bathrooms do not have a fan to vent shower steam, other than that the room was fine. They did change all the CRT T.V's to high-def the last day we were there. The pool is a little too small and is shaded most of the day. The complimentary breakfast was a bonus, with eggs, toast, bacon, sausage, pancakes, cereal, juice and coffee. However it is the same everyday. All in all, the value was great for a family stay with a 15 minute walk to Disney. Lots of great places to eat nearby. Will

Short 15 - 20 minute walk to Disneyland and surrounded by numerous cafes and restaurants. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and tidy. Free breakfast was good.Would happily stay there again for another Disney adventure.

Summary Heading: Bring cash if you want Disney tickets
Summary: The hotel is pretty nice. Rooms are clean. Taking shuttle to Disney, but I hear the walk is about 20 minutes.  Pool and hot tub were good. Breakfast is just OK, not great, but free.  However, if you want to buy Disney and shuttle tickets, you have to buy them with cash at this hotel. Really , who carries that much cash? So, buy online before you come.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel mainly because of the price & proximity to Disneyland main gates. First of all, the associates at the front desk was so wonderful & friendly at all times. You were always greeted by the staff throughout the hotel. It was fabulous while leaving for the day or just arriving back! The complimentary breakfast was GREAT! The young South Asian man at the desk was very friendly & made sure the food was always hot & fresh. You should make sure you are there within the 1st hour of breakfast being served...as it fills up quite quickly; & I don't like the 2 of us taking up tables for 6 people! My only complaint is the small little bumps & scratches; our shower curtain was really fit for the pit (full of holes) & the wear & tear was apparent through this hotel.

Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights. Nothing wrong with the rooms, there is a weird configuration of the bathroom door and the entrance door but nothing major. Bed is comfortable.   Plus: place is closed to Disneyland, if that's the goal of your visit. Free parking, free wifi. It has laundry facilities which can be quite useful.   Cons: the free breakfast is a joke, its only redeeming aspect is that it's free. The orange juice tasted like it was 1/5 juice, 4/5 water. I wasn't expecting much of a free breakfast and it wasn't much indeed.  Got woken up every morning. When it wasn't from the garbage truck in the parking lot, it was from our alarm ringing at 5h30 one morning. Strangest part is we never touched the alarm (we always use our phones).... My only explanation is that the cleaning
Manager Response: If you ever decide to give Anaheim another chance, we will be more than glad to receive you, we will make sure to ammend our mistakes.

Summary: Excellent room, huge breakfast, within walking distance of Disney and close to the I5 for visiting LA and Universal Studios. We loved it and would recommend the hotel to anyone travelling to Anaheim. We even got a discount for staying for five nights.

Summary Heading: nice hotel, but staff could do better
Summary: Good location, walking distance to Disneyland and shopping plaza.  The exterior of hotel looked big and clean.  The room looked clean.  But the carpet was dirty.  My cleaned feet were black from walking  barefoot on the carpet.  The room had a certain odor.  I noticed stains on some towels.  The front desk staff greeted us everytime we come or go.  A few times I overheard them cracking jokes of the other guests.  I don;t think they should make fun of guests staying at their hotel. Be respectful to the guests. Breakfast was ok.  They should have more variety instead of the same things every morning.  I felt like I was being rushed during breakfast.  The staff came and took my plate away when I was still eatng.  One guy was vacuuming the floor right next to my table.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your input, we will make sure to improve, to make your next stay better.

Summary: Good size comfortable room, though the bathroom was a little dated.  Breakfast was nice: toast, cereal, bacon, eggs, hot cakes, and juices.  Well located for getting to Disneyland, Garden Walk Mall, Cheesecake Factory and California Pizza Kitchen.  Anaheim Angels Stadium and the Amtrak Station are just a short taxi/bus ride away.

Hotel was clean, rooms great size pool area and laundry clean and all well maintained.Staff very helpful and friendly. Room cleaning daily was of a very high standard could not fault the hotel - Breakfast had a good choice, hot food always available overall we had a great stay.

Summary: My two kids and I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in late August, and we couldn't have been happier with our choice.  It's an easy walk to the main gates for Disneyland and California Adventure, but far enough away to not be bother by the pedestrian or traffic noise.  The rooms were spacious and clean, the staff very helpful and friendly, and the breakfast was a nice bonus, although they ran out of cutlery and plates more than once.  The pool was clean and it was great to have guest laundry facilities available.  I would definitely stay here again - oh yeah - the price was great too!

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for four nights while visiting Disneyland. The hotel is within walking distance to Disneyland and is also very close to Gardenwalk (a shopping center) and the convention center. I have stayed here twice and have had good stays both times.  Our room was on the upper floors and was a king room. The furniture, fixtures and amenities were all nice and the bed was very comfortable. The AC and fan worked great and made very little noise. Considering the hotel has plenty of children (since it is close to Disneyland) the noise level in the room was very low. The room was clean and housekeeping was very attentive during our stay. Summary: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. A great location for Disneyland and nearby restaurants. We were on the 4th floor with the room windows overlooking Disney land so we saw the fire work display each night. No problems with the room except that the shower had very low water pressure, told the front desk but had no response. Generally the staff at the front desk were very helpful. The "free" breakfast was a bit of a joke really as there was only one toaster to make toast and so you guessed it, line up for toast. The breakfast choices were reasonable but then what do you expect as its "free". They had two computers set up in the lobby which allowed us to check emails as we did not bring our laptop  We would stay here again as its central.

Summary: We stayed 4 nights while visiting Disneyland. The location was great, as it was only one half mile walk to the park. The rooms were nice and large and the air conditioning worked very well.  My only issues were 1: that there was no bathroom fan; 2: the internet didn't work very well at all. The 3g I had on my phone worked much better; and 3: our tv didn't work and had to have it replaced. The breakfast was very nice to have, and overall it was a great hotel.

Summary: We were very pleased with this hotel - we thought the price was excellent, staff were lovely and helpful and a great location - close to disney theme parks - easy walk and very easy to find off the main freeways.  Very happy we chose to the breakfast included package, was plenty to eat each morning and a nice seperate dinner area to eat.  The room was lovely and clean, beds were very comfy and room serviced to a high standard every day.  The staff were always friendly and knowledgable of the area.  Great display of brochures in lobby for all attractions nearby and free wifi and parking was another excellent bonus.  Overall very happy with our decision to stay here and would definitely stay here again.

This place is great for saving money!

Summary: My family of 5 stayed @ this hotel from Sept 1/2011 - Sept 6/2011.  I was SO excited to have found a hotel within walking distance to Disneyland, with a complimantary breakfast, free parking and a gym.  Ramada Plaza seemed to be spot on and I bragged about it to all of my friends who had visited Disneyland within the year!  My issues with this hotel are:  -The free WiFi is a joke.  In our room, the ONLY person that could get onto it was my 15 year old daughter on her iPod.  I either had to go without or I had to go downstairs and use their computers.  - The free American breakfast was falsely advertised.  Yes, it was free.  But, the menu stated that it had bagels, muffins, pastries, and fruit - along with the toast, eggs, hashbrowns, PLAIN oatmeal, orange slices, pancakes and

Summary: We had a room on the 4th floor, very clean, although quite small, it suited our needs for a family of 4.  It was walking distance to Disneyland, but after walking in the park all day, the walk back to the hotel was grueling.  We took the shuttle bus back, it was free for the 1/2 marathoners that weekend, use #16 or you can take #9 on the way back, it will drop you off across the street on Harbor & just cross the street.  We had other family members stay at Travelodge & said they should have stayed with us!  Oh, there was also complimentary buffet breakfast of eggs, hash browns, oatmeal, sausage, bacon, pancakes & assorted cold cereals.  It was an easy way to start the day!

Summary Heading: Hotel is OK, can be better
Summary: One good thing about this hotel is that it's close to Disneyland, and the room is pretty clean.  Now the issues that we have...  the wifi connection is terrible!  The speed is like 3g (if best) and the connection kicks us off for at least 2 times when you're logged in.  We called the front desk and I guess the best that they could do about it is just rebooting the router (but with the same results).  As for the old maid that we get everyday on the 4th floor is rude and doesn't speak english.  She never put the trash bag on any of the trash cans, she just throws the bag in it and we have to put it on.  My wife ask her for an extra  bar of soap and she gave her a dirty look and tosses the bar on a cart.  Don't get me wrong, the rest of the staffs are nice and all.  The free
