Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights. We had a family room with 2 double beds and a sleeper sofa. The room was huge! The sleeper-sofa wasn't the most comfortable but our son slept well... has long as he didin't move to much, it squeaked!  About a 15-20 minute walk to disney. That was fine with us. When we walked, we saw other hotel we were considering, so glad we chose the Ramada, even if we had to walk a bit more... but not that much! We felt very safe walking late at night.The surrounding hotels have exterior corridors but not the Ramada, all indoor corridors and indoor free parking. Breakfast was ok, always the same. Front desk staff was very polite and helpful. He gave us homemade cookies for our daughter's birthday. The pool and spa area were clean. They have a sauna but did not try
Manager Response: ENJOYED Dear Valued Guest: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments on Trip Advisor regarding your stay with us at the Ramada Plaza Anaheim. We appreciate your comments and use them as a way to improve so that we may provide a service that exceeds guest expectations. We are pleased to hear that your stay was an enjoyable one and we look forward to hosting your next stay in the Anaheim Resort area. Sincerely,  Management Ramada Plaza Anaheim “Best of Ramada Award” – 2013, 2012, 2011, 2010, 2006, 2005, 2003

Summary Heading: The Hotel is ok but nothing special, has some minor issues
Summary: The term resort is a stretch in the name of this hotel. We were at the hotel during the peak tourist season so some of the issues we had were probably a result of utilization at this time of year.  The rooms are OK, clean and comfortable.  The room we stayed in (444) had tape over two holes in the shower cur-tin and we could never get the proper number of towels and coffee was not left in the room. We left notes for the maid but still had problems. The breakfast is good though the wait staff act put out with the process of cleaning tables and supplying the buffet.  Though we we reserved the room for a family of five they only gave us breakfast tickets for four, we had to buy additional tickets for the extra person. The hotel is large and therefore get to the breakfast early as
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments on Trip Advisor regarding your stay with us at the Ramada Plaza Anaheim. We appreciate your comments and use them as a way to improve so that we may provide a service that exceeds guest expectations. We are sorry that we failed to do so during your stay with us.  We understand that this review is from 2011 but would still like to take the time to respond.  The Ramada Plaza Anaheim has taken huge strides  since 2011 when it comes to the  operations of the hotel. We are proud to share that we have received the "Best of Ramada" Award for 2013, an award given to only a handful of hotels in California.  Again, we apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced during your stay but hope that you might consider giving us another chance the next time you are travelling in the Anaheim Resort area. Sincerely,  Management Ramada Plaza Anaheim “Best of Ramada Award” – 2013, 2012, 2011, 2010, 2006, 2005, 2003

Summary: I stayed there last week for a short visit to Disneyland and LA. I loved it. The rooms were comfortable and just a 10 minute walk to Disneyland. The breakfast was included, but wasn't my cup of tea, the usual eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, etc. Really good stay.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments on Trip Advisor regarding your stay with us at the Ramada Plaza Anaheim. We appreciate your comments and use them as a way to improve so that we may provide a service that exceeds guest expectations. We are pleased to hear that your stay was an enjoyable one and we look forward to hosting your next stay in the Anaheim Resort area. Sincerely,  Management Ramada Plaza Anaheim “Best of Ramada Award” – 2013, 2012, 2011, 2010, 2006, 2005, 2003

Summary Heading: Staff were friendly, reccommend for families
Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights (from the 16th of June to the 18th of June 2011). We stayed in a family room with two queen beds, free wireless internet and our package came with free buffet breakfest. The breakfest was nice and there was a variety of food to choose from Its approx 10 min walking distance to Disneyland and approx 2-3 minute walk to a strip of shops where there is a subway restaurant, pizza restaurant and others, and across that street there is a grocery store and a seven eleven  Staff were helpful and arranged our ticket purchase for disneyland where its cheaper to buy at the hotel compared to the gate at disneyland  There is a pool but we didnt utilise.
Manager Response: We are very pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay at the Ramada Plaza Anaheim Resort. Our property has a very convenient location, as we are near the Anaheim Convention Center, Disneyland Park, Garden walk, Honda Center, Angeles Stadium, and many other attractions as well. Here at the Ramada Plaza Hotel, customer satisfaction is our number one priority. So if you have any comments or suggestions please do not hesitate to let anyone of the staff members know as we try to make each and every day better than the previous day. Please do visit us or any other Wyndham property during your next stay in Anaheim.

Summary: We stayed here for four nights while visiting Disneyland. We got a room with 2 queens and a sofa sleeper, which fit the 6 of us just fine. The beds were great. Next time I will get two rooms, sharing a bathroom with 4 teens was no fun. The water pressure in the shower was a bit weak, and they need to update the t.v., but overall it was a good room. The free breakfast was ok, just the basics (eggs, bacon, toast, oatmeal, cereal, juice,  coffee,  hashbrowns)  , but the same choices everyday. Would have liked some variety,  but it was free, and free is good when your feeding 6.
Manager Response: We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay here at the Ramada Plaza Anaheim Hotel. Our hotel is in the process of changing our TVs. We are just waiting for the manufacture, but they should be in all the rooms within the next couple of months. As far as Breakfast variety, we can notify this information to the resturant owner. Please due visit us again during your next try down in Anaheim. If you haven't made any plans for the Holidays due visit us again. Our hotel starting mid November will be flled with Christmas decorations from top to bottom.

Summary: Clean room and bath. Comfy beds. The walls are a little thin, so bring earplugs. The hot buffet breakfast was EXCELLENT, but get there early to beat the crowd.
Manager Response: On behalf of the hotel, I like to thank you for your loyalty in choosing our hotel. Our breakfast buffet promotion was a huge sucess this year, so it looks like we will continue it for the following year as well. Please due visit us again during your next trip down in Anaheim. If you haven't made any plans for the Holidays due visit us again. Our hotel starting mid November will be flled with Christmas decorations from top to bottom. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Most likely will stay here again.....
Summary: We looked at so many reviews before deciding on a place to stay during this busy time of year at Disneyland right after Christmas. We chose this hotel based on reviews, location and price - and we were not disappointed. It was a peasant surprise to find that they had underground parking. The check-in was relatively quick. The walk to Disneyland is not bad at all. The two children did not mind the walk back after being in the park all day. Grandma rode the ART shuttle back each night because she did not want to stay as late as the others. This hotel is on a shuttle route that only has 5 stops. They are quite spread out, so it is not a quick process, but not bad at all.  We had adjoining rooms and they were both clean and not too small. We would have liked to have had an exhaust
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful comment on tripadvisor. Here at the Ramada Plaza Hotel, we always love to see our guest, such as yourself, enjoying their stay on our property. Please due visit us again during your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary: When all the recommended hotels for our IDDBA tradeshow were full, I was really worried that we wouldn't get any accommodations that would be adequate.  To my surprise, this hotel went waaaay beyond "adequate".  From the greatest desk clerk (Johnny), to the fantastic complimentary breakfast, to the cleanliness of the rooms, it made for a wonderful experience and one that I will be sure to pass on to anyone that will be visiting Anaheim!   Keep up the great job!!!  Dolores Parker
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your comments with us on Trip Advisor. We are very pleased to hear that you had a pleasent stay in Anaheim. Many of our frequnet guest believe that we are the best kept secret in Anaheim, so we encourage you to tell everyone about your plesent stay! Be sure to give us a call the next time you are in our area! Best regards!

Summary: We had reservations but work problems caused a late start and we arrived late on 6/8/11, the front desk was courteous and helpful even at 11:30 P.M. The rooms are clean and nice the beds are comfortable the bathrooms clean with ample towels. The staff that clean the rooms are friendly and do a great job.  The entrance to Disneyland is 2 stop lights away from the hotel well within walking distance. The problem is, after walking around Disneyland all day it is a bit of a hike back. Try and get a 4th floor room facing Disneyland for a comfortable view of the fireworks.   A buffet breakfast is included, scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, oatmeal, small pancakes (my 4 year old granddaughter liked them the most), some fruit, dry cereal, juice tea and coffee. I don't know how hot the
Manager Response: On behalf of the Ramada Plaza Hotel, we are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay. Be sure to give us a call the next time you are in our area! Best regards!

Summary Heading: Great mid range hotel for families.
Summary: Stayed here for 5 nights in April. Literally 10 minute walk to DisneyLand - easy. Rooms are clean and well maintained. Free breakfast is just average,pretty basic, but it is included. Free wifi. Great service at front desk for tours etc. Walking distance to Cheesecake Factory, best place to eat in Anaheim. Also close to Bubba Gumps.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time out of your day to share your experience with us on tripadvisor. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your trip here at the Ramada Plaza Anaheim Hotel, not only because of our great location, but also because of our hotel quality in customer service as well. We are looking forward to seeing you again in the near future. Should you need any assistance with reservations please feel free to contact the hotel at anytime.

Summary Heading: Hard to beat for value and location
Summary: We spent 8 nights at the Ramada Plaza in early April and had a brilliant stay. After a long flight from Australia we arrived at the hotel and asked if we could park there prior to checkin later that day, we were pleasantly surprised to be given an early check in over 4 hours early. The family room with 2 queen beds and pull out sofa was excellent value for the price we paid and the beds were very comfortable after long days out with the kids. The complimentary full American breakfast each morning was more than we had expected, and considering it was Spring break and very very busy,  the friendly and welcoming staff in the restaurant did a great job looking after everyones needs. The front office staff met all our needs promply when asked and our housekeeper did a great job with
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your comments with us on Trip Advisor. We are very pleased to hear that you had a pleasent stay in Anaheim this past April.  Many of our frequnet guest believe that we are the best kept secret in Anaheim, so we encourage you to tell everyone about your plesent stay! Be sure to give us a call the next time you are in our area! Best regards!

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay at Ramada Plaza.  We had initially booked Ramada Maingate, but were so disappointed that we decided to move to Ramada Plaza.  The staff were very welcoming and the rooms were clean and comfortable.  The walk to Disneyland maingate was a bit further, but convenient as we usually always stopped in at the 7/11 on the corner to buy water and other refreshments.  They did offer free internet as well, but for some reason we couldn't connect to it and we didn't bother to follow it up.  Would thoroughly recommend Ramada Plaza to any family with small children.
Manager Response: We are very pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay at the Ramada Plaza Anaheim Resort. Our property has a very convenient location, as we are near the Anaheim Convention Center, Disneyland Park, Garden walk, Honda Center, Angeles Stadium, and many other attractions as well. Here at the Ramada Plaza Hotel, customer satisfaction is our number one priority. So if you have any comments or suggestions please do not hesitate to let anyone of the staff members know as we try to make each and every day better than the previous day. Please do visit us or any other Wyndham property during your next stay in Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for families going to Disneyland
Summary: 8-10 minutes walk to Disneyland make this a great place to access Disneyland. Hotel staff at the front desk were all amazingly friendly, helpful and courteous. made for a very relaxing stay. Room (2 Queens) was very spacious, housekeeping was great and Tim was a constant laugh at the Front Desk. The staff will go the extra mile to help out the customers, which was hugely appreciated by all of us being in Anaheim for the first time, particularly our 10 year old son. Pool was being re-furbished, so cannot comment on it. Breakfast was OK - nice to have it complimentary, but lacked a bit of choice for people who can't handle bacon and eggs in the mornings. . Overall a good experience, with the staff being absolutely great and a credit to the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful comment on tripadvisor. Here at the Ramada Plaza Hotel, we always love to see our guest, such as yourself, enjoying their stay on our property. Please due visit us again during your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary: We new from the min we walked in it was going to be bad. The hotel clerks were not friendly at all!!! We got checked in and got to the room, it was dirty we all walked around GRUMPY. So the next morning i called our agency that booked us and they didn't have any opening any were. Well the next morning wen't down to contential breakfast all I can say is wow they had run out of cereal for the kids said we have no more they didn't speak very good english so we got by with pancakes and what was left of the syrup. The next morning We returned for Breakfast and once again there was no cereal No clean tables no forks to eat with they said they had run out and instead of hash browns they had french fries they said the owner didn't order any.. Wow it was a scary deal. So back to the room
Manager Response: All of us at the Ramada Plaza Anaheim Resort value you and you’re comments; we are truly sorry for the inconvenience we caused you. We know you have many choices for lodging and appreciate your decision to stay with us at the Ramada Plaza Anaheim during your recent trip to Anaheim. On behalf of the Management, we take great pride and pledge that each guest has an enjoyable stay as we welcome every guest comments, for this is the only way we can make improvements in our product and service. Your comments have been passed to our entire management staff of our property, the restaurant staff, as well as Get Away Today. Once again you are truly sorry, and hope to see you soon at anyone of the Wyndham Hotel’s Worldwide.

Summary Heading: Great front desk service and comfortable firm beds.
Summary: Great location.  Comfortable rooms. Housekeeping service was fair.  They don't clean the rooms as well as one might expect but the hotel lobby is very clean. Service at the front desk is exceptional!  The free breakfast is a real bargain.  Well within walking distance to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Yes, our hotel has a great location between the Anaheim Convention Center and Disneyland.  We have a Full American Breakfast Buffet included, along with free wireless internet and free parking. Being part of the Ramada Brand, our main priority is satisfying each and every hotel guest as best as possible. Whether your stay is for Business, Family or Pleasure, our hotel values all suggestions that you have to offer. Please due visit us again during your next trip to Anaheim, California.

Summary Heading: good location to Disney, food choices right next door
Summary: Ok hotel, nothing fancy (thin walls), but only a10-15 minute walk to Disney which was nice.  We were able to walk back to the hotel and put on warmer clothes.  At the end of the night I had to put my 5- year old on my shoulders for the walk home (wasn't the most comfortable, but doable).  Strip mall right next door has your choice of food from Subway, pizza, Mexican, Chinese and ice cream.  In addition, there is a 7-11 across the street.  Would recommend stuffing a backpack FULL of snacks and renting strollers (1 for $15, 2 for $25).
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time out of your day to share your experience with us on tripadvisor. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your trip here at the Ramada Plaza Anaheim Hotel. I am also happy to see that you enjoyed the great location of our hotel. Yes we are very close to a variety of resturants, the Anaheim Convention Center, Disneyland, and the Anaheim Gardenwalk. We are looking forward to seeing you again in the near future. Should you need any assistance with reservations please feel free to contact the hotel at anytime.

Summary Heading: Spotless Hotel with great Customer Service
Summary: The hotel was spotless clean and the customer service was fabulous. We arrived around 1pm and were able to check in early, even though there was no vacancy. The staff were very friendly! The free breakfast was buffet style with fresh watermelon/oranges and eggs, bacon, sausage, hash browns, etc. A great way to start the day before going to disney. It is a long walk to disney, at least 10 minutes. While it is a nice walk, on sidewalks with lined palm trees; it is too far for little legs after a long day at disney and too far for tired parents to carry kids. Perfect for those still in strollers. There is a city shuttle, but we didn't use it as it was inconvient.  Nice, warm pool and hot tub, too. They also had free computer access and printer access. They helped us to arrange
Manager Response: Thank you for your response. We value all of your suggestions, and hope that you visit us again soon. Please contact the hotel to make your next reservation!

Summary Heading: Okay but not great so will try elsewhere next time
Summary: For some reason I expected a bit more of an upscale feel to the hotel.  I was definitely underwhelmed when we arrived.  The hotel is dated but very clean.  I have no complaints about the service or the cleanliness.  Rooms, linens, and towels were cleaned promptly and well.  The rooms were spotless in all areas. I guess it depends on what amenities and feel you expect from a hotel as a traveler.  I found the towels to be small and the washing clothes and towels to be very rough.  Not plush at all, they were like wal-mart towels.  With that being said  it is only a 3 star hotel and we did get a good price but I wouldn't say  a bargain so I'd expect nice towels and upgraded interior. The pool area was underwhelming and the buffet breakfast gets a thumbs down from me. The food was
Manager Response: Thank you for your comment on Trip Advisor.  The owner is well aware that our hotel needs to be upgraded in various areas to better fit all of our travelers. Right now we are scheduled to renovate the following: entire pool at the end of this month, and the hotel lobby this coming summer. As for our room amenities, our Executive Housekeeper had already ordered brand new towels for the entire hotel. We are currently still waiting for them to arrive.   On behalf of the hotel staff, I apologize that our hotel didn't live up to your hotel expectations during your recent trip. Here at the Ramada Plaza, we do value all comments/suggestions and would greatly appreciate any input you may have. Whether it is our hotel or not, we still hope that you would still consider staying at any of Wyndham Property during your next stay in Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Nice quiet hotel within walking distance of Disney
Summary: We enjoyed this hotel, it was very nice- clean, and quiet.  The staff was very friendly.  Plenty of room for my spouse and I and 3 children under 10; we had the room with 2 queens and a sofa bed.  My wife and I slept reasonably well; for some reason at most hotels we wake up with sore backs in the morning; but this was not an issue at this hotel.  The only negative about the hotel was the free buffet breakfast; it was in the Indian restaurant on the first floor; it attempted to have an American style breakfast with eggs, pancakes, and sausage, etc-- but the food was not that great; we ended up skipping the free breakfast on the 2nd day.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful comment on Tripadvisor. I am glad that you enjoyed the comforts of our queen-size beds. As far as the quality and service of the breakfast, I will forward your remarks to the resturant owner. Once again thank you for your comments on your recent stay. We look forward in seeing you again. Please feel free to contact us if you have any questions or need assistance on your next reservation.

Summary Heading: Pay the extra $ to stay at a place with it's own shuttle or stay at a motel across the street
Summary: The website says that there is a shuttle but they don't mention that it is an anaheiem resort transportation bus which is like public transit. (Nice on the way there but it takes 25 min to get back that didn't include 20 min+ wait time)because the ramada is the last stop. Also the front desk did not give me any of this info or offer to sell us shuttle passes for cheaper. We spent 25$ the first day as opposed to the 9$ it would of cost if the front desk let me know when I asked how to buy tickets her reply was the bus...when I told the manager she offered no explanation or compensation-I hate to say it but she played dumb.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments on Trip Advisor regarding your stay with us at the Ramada Plaza Anaheim. We appreciate your comments and use them as a way to improve so that we may provide a service that exceeds guest expectations. We are sorry that we failed to do so during your stay with us.  We understand that this review is from 2011 but would still like to take the time to respond.   We apologize if  our staff was not clear on the shuttle service to Disneyland Resort.  The Ramada Plaza Anaheim does not personally offer a shuttle service. However, there is the ART bus that picks up in front of the hotel and will bring you to and from Disneyland Resort.   There are five hotel stops on our route. Yes, we are the last on the route which means you would be first to be dropped off at Disneyland Resort, but the last to be dropped back to the hotel. It takes approximately 20 minutes on the ART bus. The present price for a one day all day pass is $5.00 for an adult and $2.00 for children ages 3-9 if purchased at the front desk..Again, we apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced during your stay but hope that you might consider giving us another chance the next time you are travelling in the Anaheim Resort area. Sincerely,  Management Ramada Plaza Anaheim “Best of Ramada Award” – 2013, 2012, 2011, 2010, 2006, 2005, 2003

Summary Heading: Quiet hotel within walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: Stayed here for a weekend to visit Disneyland. I took a gamble on it because the price I locked in was too good to pass up & included a free breakfast buffet as well.  The desk staff was very friendly, the hotel & my room was very clean. I enjoyed the hotel because it is approximately 3 blocks from Disneyland or about a 15 minute walk. It is also on Katella which is a little less noisy than Harbor blvd that Disneyland resort resides on.  I would definitely stay here again in the future for easy access to Disneyland!
Manager Response: First of all, on behalf of the Ramada Plaza Anaheim Hotel, we would like to thank you for considering our hotel during you recent trip to Anaheim. If you have any comments or suggestions, fill free to contact any of the hotel staff at any time. We are pleased to hear that you had a pleasent stay, and look forward in seeing you again really soon. Fill free to contact the hotel directly to book your next trip.

Summary Heading: Mediocre Hotel - and don't expect internet
Summary: This was our company's second time staying at the hotel, with a nearby convention being the draw.  Last year's experience was quite good, but the hotel has gone downhill since.  We will not stay at the hotel again.  Everything at the hotel is mediocre.  This can be fine if that's all you are expecting, but it offers little more.  Worth mentioning is that the internet was extremely slow and unreliable for our entire visit. We mentioned the problem to the front desk each and every day and were assured that the problem would be fixed - but each day passed and we were greeted with the same questions by a new front desk agent (i.e. "did you try to restart your computer")  Every one of our rooms was having problems with the internet - so it is clearly a problem of the hotel's.  We
Manager Response: I apologize for the inconvenience that your group had during your recent trip in Anaheim. Our management staff is well aware of the internet problems that were faced in a couple of your rooms during the convention last week. Everything has was been reported to our internet company, and changes are going to be made with our system to prevent this problem from happening again. All of us at the Ramada Plaza Anaheim Resort value you and you’re comments; and we are truly sorry for the inconvenience we caused you and your company. We hope that you still consider staying at anyone of the Ramada brands’ worldwide.

Summary: It is definitely a great place to stay and is walking distance from Disneyland. Spent 5 nights at first and decided not to change hotel and extended for another 3 nights in the same hotel after our great experiences with the stay.  Our room was spacious.  No problem with the walls or noise. Breakfast was not fantastic, especially after many days with the same foods, i.e. toast, scramble eggs, bacons, etc.  Staff in the restaurant (definitely shorthanded) is not as friendly as the hotel staff.  But it is really not a bother since it is supposed to be buffet (which mean self-service).
Manager Response: The hotel is very pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay here at the Ramada Plaza Anaheim Hotel. Since the resturant is seperately owned, we will try our best to speak with the resturant owner to improve their quality and service. Here at the Ramada Plaza hotel, we value all possible feedbacks, as we are always trying to improve ourselves by "making today better than yesterday." We hope to see you again really soon and your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Our new home for Disneyland stays
Summary: How is it possible we have overlooked this hotel after staying at numerous area hotels.This Ramada Plaza (not to be confused with Ramada Maingate) had everything on our list including a great price booked directly through the hotel website.  From the lobby to the spacious, clean room with high ceilings complete with crown moldings and higher end bed linens and the warm clean pool with nice towels we were greeted with everything looking attractive.On our list is also free parking and a close walk to the parks.The really special thing that sets this hotel apart is the wonderful, complete breakfast with a nice place to sit and enjoy.The front desk was helpful and even brought up glass wine glasses per my request as the room had only thin disposable cups.What a deal!We will not stay
Manager Response: We are very pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay during your recent trip to Anaheim, California. Most individuals due tend to overlook our hotel, for they find it is toooo far from the Disneyland Park entrance. But as you can see, we are clearly not that far at all. Our location is fairly close to the Anaheim Convention center, as well as the Anaheim Gardenwalk. Were you able to visit the Anaheim Gardenwalk? There is always something new and exciting going on in Anaheim such as the new "Battle of the Dance" dinner show. We hope that you visit us again on your next trip down in Anaheim California. Don't hesitate to pick up the phone and call the hotel directly for your next reservation.    If you have any additional comments or suggestions, please feel free to let us know.

Summary: I like this hotel - didn't expect much actually given that it was a package tour - but this hotel was a pleasant surprise.  My room was very spacious and clean.  The location is good too - pretty near Disneyland.  There are good restaurants nearby too!  I would commend the tour agency for their good choice of hotel.
Manager Response: On behalf of the staff here at the Ramada Plaza, we are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your recent trip in Anaheim. There are so many new attractions that are coming up next year in Disneyland that you don't want to miss. Feel free to contact the hotel directly if you have any questions or concerns, or need help arranging your next trip down here in southern california.

Summary: My fiancée and I stayed at the Ramada Resort while in town to visit Knotts Berry Farm. The hotel is located conveniently next to a wide varity of restaurants which made finding dinner for the evening easy, we tried out The cheesecake Factory just right down the street. The hotel is also located within walking distance  to the Disneyland parks and Disney Downtown area. After dinner we were able to walk to Downtown Disney and enjoy icecream and coffee. This made for a really good experience. Breakfast in the morning was slightly average, the orange juice was below par, everything else was fairly good. There seemed to not be enough staff. The host was directing guests and also cleaning tables. Apparently, according to management responses on other reviews this is a new system for
Manager Response: We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay here at the Ramada Plaza Anaheim Hotel. We will inform the restaurant owner in regards to the quality of their orange juice. We are slowly adjusting, but with everyone’s feedback, it truly helps improve our service to each and every hotel guest. If you have any additional comments or suggestions, please feel free to let us know. Please due visit us again on your next trip down in Anaheim California.   And lastly, “CONGRADULATIONS,” on your the upcoming wedding.

Summary: We love the Ramada Plaza!  This is our 2nd year we have stayed at this hotel and we will continue to stay here.  The room was very very comfortable, clean, great location (about a 10 min walk to the Disney gates), and AWESOME breakfast.  The free breakfast, free internet, and free parking made the value of this hotel great.  The breakfast wasnt just a small table with some bread or cereal, it was a breakfast buffet.  Every morning we had the choice of scrambled eggs, hash browns, sausage or bacon, 2 different fruits, 3 different cereals, 4 different juice, coffee, and toast/english muffins.  Plus it wasall you can eat!  We would eat breakfast then wouldnt need to buy lunch at Disney until at least 1pm.  Just the breakfast alone saved us so much money over the course of the trip
Manager Response: On behalf of the hotel, I like to thank you for your loyalty in choosing our hotel. Our breakfast buffet promotion was a huge sucess this year, so it looks like we will continue it for the following year as well. Please due visit us again during your next try down in Anaheim. If you haven't made any plans for the Holidays due visit us again. Our hotel starting mid November will be flled with Christmas decorations from top to bottom. Plus on Christmas Eve, we will continue will our story telling tradition, served with hot chocolate and cookies. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Decent hotel within 10 mins walk of Disneyland and shopping centres/restaurants. The rooms were slightly dated and basic motel rooms but ok value for money. The airconditioning unit was slightly noisy but we could not sleep with the window open due to traffic noise. In saying that, i would consider staying there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful comment on Tripadvisor. Your feedback is extremely important to us. All of us at the Ramada are pleased that you enjoyed your stay. I will forward all of your comments/suggestions to our owner, and I hope to see you again on your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Stayed at the Ramada on Kattela for three...
Summary: Stayed at the Ramada on Kattela for three nights. Found the staff extremely helpful, and the rooms were spacious, quiet and clean.Excellent location with stores and restaurants close by. $1.20 for two by bus to the Amtrak Station. Also convenient for Honda Centre and Angel Stadium. Breakfast was very good ! Many thanks for an enjoyable stay !
Manager Response: We are pleased to hear that you had a wonderful stay and hope to see you again during your next trip down in Anaheim. Come and visit us during the Holiday Season!

Summary: The hotel was very clean. The staff were very nice and helpful. The room was small (we had a king size bed). The air conditioner was VERY loud and woke me up at night. You could also hear people showering and talking from other rooms.There was a strong smell of Indian food coming from the restuarant and you had to walk by the restuarant to get to the elevators. The breakfast buffet was not very good but they had cereal for the kids (good thing it was free). The hotel is close to the Garden Walk which had other restuarant choices. There was also a 7-Eleven near by. The walk to Disneyland was about a 15 minute walk, which wasn't bad. The hotel had plenty of parking which was free :) This hotel would not be my first choice to stay at.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest:  Thank you for taking the time to share your comments on Trip Advisor regarding your stay with us at the Ramada Plaza Anaheim. We appreciate your comments and use them as a way to improve so that we may provide a service that exceeds guest expectations. We are sorry to hear that your stay overall did not exceed your expectations. We will take your comments into review and work to re-evaluate in those areas.  We hope that you would consider giving us a second chance the next time you stay in the Anaheim Resort area.  Sincerely. Management Ramada Plaza Anaheim

Summary Heading: 10 min walk to Disneyland!  Decent value.
Summary: We chose this hotel because of the location.  There was another Ramada closer to Disneyland, but the reviews were not good enough.  This Ramada Plaza was better than I expected.  It was clean and the rooms were spacious - with 2 Q beds and a sitting area.   My son used the pool both days and it was good.  It was small, but there were very few people there, so it was fine.  There is also a clean outdoor shower in the pool area which was convenient.    This year, they are including a free breakfast.  The breakfast is adequate.  The eggs, bacon, breads, sausage and hash browns are good.  There is also cereal and oatmeal.  The problem is that the breakfast is served in the hotel's Indian restaurant - so there are tv screens showing Indian music videos during breakfast and the cut
Manager Response: First of all, I would like to thank you for your positive feedback on our hotel. The Free Full American Breakfast Buffet was something new we tried out this year, and with all the positive feedbacks it looks like we will be continuing it next year as well. I will inform the owner of the restaurant about the quality of their sliced fruits.   Wi-fi rooms. As you mentioned, currently we only allow 2 users to login per-room. We are in the process of looking for another company to provide a stronger and better service for our guest. I will definitely let the owner know about your input in regards of maybe allowing more individuals to login per-room, or maybe having additional modems available at the front desk for those who need additional access.  Lastly, our hotel doesn't have a snack vending machine or a snack shop. The reason for this is because there are various stores within walking distance such as 711 for our guest. I will forward this suggestion as well to the owner. If he finds that there are more inputs in regards to this, maybe this is something we can look into for the future.  Once again thank you for your wonderful feedback on tripadvisor. Our Staff truly values your suggestions, and we look forward in seeing you again at our property. If you haven't made any plans this year, during the Christmas Holiday Season, please do visit us again. Our hotel will be decorated with Christmas decorations from top to bottom.

Summary Heading: Thin ceiling. Thin wall and loud AC
Summary: I am writing this review from this hotel at this moment at 11pm because I can hear next door's conversation, their tv and upstairs walking and showering. After long day at disneyland u want to have a good night sleep but u can't do that while all the noise going on plus the AC is really loud.  The hotel  is kinda old.  It l needs update especially in the bathroom. The tiles on the floor are cracked. The staffs are very friendly and the room are clean. But I will not return next time.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback on Tripadvisor. I am sorry to hear that you had an unpleasant stay at our hotel due to the noise volume. I will definitely forward this information to the owner to see what we can do to resolve this issue. Once again thank you for your feedback, and hopefully you’ll consider us again in the future.

Summary: Myself and 2 sons (10 & 15) arrived early am and were greeted and accomodated with a lovely room immediately by the concierge JC (exceptional employee by the way) we received no end of help with shopping advice - ice hockey tickets - everything - rooms were clean and tidy and roomy - altogether a wonderful stay
Manager Response: Our staff is pleased to hear that you had a wonderful stay at our hotel on your recent trip to Anaheim. Please visit our hotel again in December, as JC decorates our hotel with fabulous Christmas Decorations from top to bottom.

Summary: This hotel was great.  The rooms were spacious and clean, and the staff was very friendly and helpful.  The location was great, just a few blocks away from Disney and several restaurants.  The only things I would suggest for improvement are the breakfast and the televisions.  The hotel was having a free breakfast promotion and the poor staff was overwhelmed.  The television in the room was an old 24-inch CRT with a VHS player.  (VCR… seriously?!)  Other than that, I was quite pleased with out stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response on Tripadvisor. We are pleased to hear that you had a wonderful stay at our hotel during your recent trip in Anaheim. The breakfast promotion is something we are currently still working on, to get everything more efficient to satisfy the customer as best as possible. So any advice we would truly appreciate it. Also in regards for our televisions, our hotel is also in the process in buying new flat screen TV's as well as possible DVD/Blue-ray players. Due to new Ramada standards we are required to have flat screen TV's by January 2011, however our head board would like us to hold off in purchasing until our tradeshow which takes place September of this year. Once again thank you for your comment on Tripadvisor, and we hope you consider us again in the future.

Summary Heading: Very Good Hotel.  Few minor quirks
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay at the Ramda Plaza of Anaheim.  It is a great location for people wanting to go to DIsneyland.  It is about a 10 minute walk to the park entrance and makes it easy to come and go to Disneyland.  The hotel itself more than met our expectations for breakfast.  Breakfast consists of eggs, hash browns, sausage, bacon, fruit, juice and cereals.  Worth $5-$10 a person easily, but it comes free now.  It is an older but quiet hotel.  Our room had a view of the tower of terror and Screaming.  It was a corner room so we hardly heard anything all night.  The front desk staff was great and always willing to help when they could.  There is a subway right next door and a burger joint that is quite good.  A 7-11 is also across the street.  A few minor complaints but
Manager Response: Thank you for completing our survey on tripadvisor. I am pleased to hear that your family enjoyed their recent stay in Anaheim. Our Full American Breakfast Buffet promotion is something new our hotel is trying out this year. If we continue to receive positive reviews about our breakfast, we are most likely going to continue it on next year for 2011. So please do spread the word to your friends and family.  Our hotel may also seem like an older style hotel, but we always keep it updated with newer furniture, linens and technology as best as possible. You should definitely visit our hotel during the Christmas Holiday season when our whole hotel lobby is filled with Christmas decorations from top to bottom. It’s the time of the year you do not want to miss.   If I can be of assistance to you, don't hesitate to contact me directly at 714-991-6868 ext 116. We hope to see you and your family again during your next trip to Disneyland.  Sincerely, Jane Bondoc General Manager Ramad Plaza Anaheim Hotel

Summary Heading: We had a very pleasant stay
Summary: Clean, comfortable rooms, friendly staff.  15 minute walk to Disneyland.  Free garage parking.  Convenient to restaraunts, I-5 and Angels stadium.  We really enjoyed being able to get up in the morning, enjoy the complimentary buffett style American breakfast, then walk to Disneyland.  We travel to Southern California usually about once per year and we'll probably stay here from now on.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Ramada Plaza Anaheim Hotel. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay and enjoy our complimentary breakfast. We look forward for your future stay with us.  Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us and we will utilize your response by continuing to focus on making each and every guest experience the best it can be. In behalf of the entire staff of the Ramada Plaza Anaheim Hotel, we would like to thank you once again.

Summary: Nice hotel in Anaheim. The rooms are large enough. Housekeeping is good & we always found our rooms to be neat & tidy after a adventurous day @ disneyland. There is a shuttle stop very close to the hotel. But if you asked me what i liked the most in this hotel.. Its thr restaurant "Gandhi" situated there. If you an Indian or like Indian food then this is the place to be. There is buffet lunch & the best indian food i had in US at the cheapest rate. This place is a relief for all the vegetarians as there isnt much veg choice & its damn expensive.  Inshort a nice & clean hotel with good rooms & nice beds.. thats what u need after a day at disneyland & major positive is Indian restaurant within the premises.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Ramada Plaza Anaheim Hotel. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay, especially at our Gandhi Restaurant located in our hotel lobby. We value your review and hope you visit us again on your next trip to Disneyland. Again If I can be of assistance to you, don't hesitate to contact me directly at 714-991-6868 ext 116  Sincerely, Jane Bondoc General Manager Ramad Plaza Anaheim Hotel

Summary: 20 minute walk to Disneyland's main gate. Rooms were comfortable however the walls were pretty thin - we could hear the conversations of the family next door. Free computers and internet in the lobby. Reasonable selection of food for breakfast (eggs, bacon, cereal, toast etc).
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments on Trip Advisor regarding your stay with us at the Ramada Plaza Anaheim. We appreciate your comments and use them as a way to improve so that we may provide a service that exceeds guest expectations. We apologize that you found the walls to be too thin We are pleased to hear that your stay was oveall an enjoyable one and we look forward to hosting your next stay in the Anaheim Resort area. Sincerely,  Management Ramada Plaza Anaheim “Best of Ramada Award” – 2013, 2012, 2011, 2010, 2006, 2005, 2003

Summary: This is a great selection for Disney or convention center travelers. The hotel was close to Disney, we walked to and from each day.  The lobby was nice and the rooms were spacious and nicely decorated. I loved the covered parking and the complimentary breakfast.  The staff was very friendly.  The front desk was very helpful. This was a great place to stay.  I will defiantly be back.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time out of your schedule to complete our Guest Survey regarding your recent stay at our hotel.  Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us and we will utilize your response by continuing to focus on making each and every guest experience the best it can be. Again, thank you for completing our survey and if I can be of assistance to you, don't hesitate to contact me directly at 714-991-6868 ext 116  Sincerely, Jane Bondoc General Manager Ramad Plaza Anaheim Hotel

Summary: Arrived, our AC didn't work.  They were very helpful and fixed it the next morning.  Front desk staff was wonderful as was the staff during the breakfast buffet.  Our room was great.  A little small but it was nice to have a fridge and microwave.  Pool was small but it worked for our kids.  Very happy with the free breakfast buffet.  Very clean!  Overall, we were very happy!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time out of your schedule to complete our Guest Survey regarding your recent stay at our hotel. Sincerely, Jane Bondoc General Manager Ramada Plaza Anaheim, CA

Summary Heading: Good location, Great beds, delicious breakfast!
Summary: The hotel was only a 10-15 min walk to the front gates of Disneyland.  The free parking and internet was a bonus.  The free hot breakfast was awesome.   The room was very large and the beds were very comfortable.  The shower head had super water pressure which I loved since most hotels nowadays go for the low pressure water saving ones.  We had a nice corner suite in the back of the hotel close to the service elevator which allowed us to get up and down to the parkade with ease.  My only complaint would be that our room had a door connecting to the room next to us and we could hear their conversations.  Luckily for us, it was only during the early evening so it didn't bother us.  It could have been worse if we had bad neighbors.  We got a great deal @ $88 per night.  I would
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest:  I am glad to hear that enjoyed your recent stay with us. I would like to thank you personally and in behalf of the entire staff at the Ramada Plaza Anaheim. We value your feedback, and will be looking into the noise situation to provide a solution soon.  Also, we are glad that you will be staying with us again in the future, if you need any assistance with your reservation, we are always here to provide service to anyone.   Again, thank you for completing our survey and if I can be of assistance to you, don't hesitate to contact me directly at 714-991-6868 ext 116.  Sincerely, Jane Bondoc General Manager Ramada Plaza Anaheim, CA

Summary: Stayed at the Ramada Plaza for 8 nights. The hotel has a great location for ALL things Anaheim. Disneyland is within walking distance. I walked, but i'm sure the Ramada would offer a shuttle bus for it's guests. If you don't hire a vehicle (i didn't), there is an excellent public transit bus service which operates out the front of the hotel. You can catch a bus for a ten minute (or so) ride to the AMTRAK Station. It's a great way to travel to downtown Los Angeles. I also caught the train to San Diego from the Anaheim Station. The Ramada Plaza is also located a few steps from an impressive outdoor-style shopping precinct. The hotel itself  exceeded my expectations. The room i got was huge! I was on my own, but this room would have been perfect for a family. It had 2 Queen size
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments on Trip Advisor regarding your stay with us at the Ramada Plaza Anaheim. Summary Heading: It was just ok, hoping for more
Summary: My wife and our two year old stayed here for two nights for a disneyland vacation.  The front desk staff were very nice and helpful.  Parking was easy.  I found the bed's comfortable as were the pillows.  The room and bathroom were clean.  Our problem came in the form of such thin walls, and a very loud air conditioner.  Our room had a door connecting it to the adjacent room, we could hear everything.  This was not a family being rude just talking on there cell phones, kids talking what have you, however when you are trying to sleep it was very fustrating.  To be honest when our two year old woke up in the middle of the night crying I am sure we fustrated them as well.  When the fan would kick in, it was ridiculous how loud this thing was.  As for location we walk pretty brisk

Summary Heading: Good location, good service, nice room
Summary: In town of a conference at the convention center, and remembered this place as having very clean facilities. The rooms were very well kept and the hotel grounds were well maintained. I will definitely make this my regular hotel in the area, and when I bring my family out to Disneyland this is definitely where we will stay.

Summary: This was a last minute trip for our 14th anniversary.  We had a great room. Staff was super friendly and helpful!  restraunt had excellent food.  10 minute walk to/from Disneyland.  We loved it so much , we are booking a trip with our family for April!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest:   I am glad to hear that enjoyed your recent stay with us. I would like to thank you personally and  in behalf of the entire staff of the Ramada Plaza Anaheim. Summary Heading: Pretty nice hotel, but a bit of a walk with no shuttle
Summary: My wife and I stayed here during Dec. 20 - Dec 23 2009. The hotel itself was roomy, nice, and clean. Although the walls next to the adjacent room were the in-room door connects were a bit thin. We could hear our neighbors into the early morning hours. But since it didn't happen until our last night there, we didn't complain. The location was a bit far, so if you consider taking breaks during your stay and heading back and forth to the hotel, this place might not be for you. The hotel also does not provide any shuttle service to and from Disneyland. The rates were very good, especially since we went during Christmas week. I would probably not stay here again if given the option, unless some sort of shuttle service is offerred. Walking all the way back from Disneyland after
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time out of your schedule to complete our Guest Survey regarding your recent stay at our hotel. Summary Heading: Great location, friendly service and great value.
Summary: We had a large group of 9 stay in 2 rooms from Dec 26-28. One room had 5 people with two beds and a pull out couch and the other room had 4 people with two beds. Check in was friendly and quick. The free and extremely close parking was a big surprise. We really only used the rooms to clean up and sleep in as the rest if the time was spent at Disneyland. Every one of us thought the beds were comfortable and I was very impressed by the cleanliness. The fridge and microwave were nice. My only complaint was that the coffee maker only makes 1 cup at a time. Considering the incredible price we paid, this is probably the best value I have ever seen. Clean, quiet and comfortable. I don't know what else you could ask for. Add in the location and friendly service, and the Ramada was just

Summary Heading: Nice, decent hotel for the rate and convenience
Summary: I stayed 4 nights in carousel Inn and 2 nights in ramada plaza. I must say the stay in Ramada Plaza is much comfortable.  Its a decent hotel, lobby, hotel rooms and laundry area are all located within an enclosed buidling. Thus no need to put on winter coat if you are going to other rooms or laundry rooms.  Rooms are big with writing desk which comes with working chair and arm chair.  Amenities are rather complete with Shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, mouthwash and shower cap. Other hotels which are charging higher don't provide such decent amenities.  Convenience stores and food outlet is also just next block.  However 2 of the front office staffs that I encountered who were male were not friendly. No smile and seems a littel impatient. There is only a lady staff who were

Summary: We stayed at this hotel on the dates of December 11th - December 14th, for the reason of visiting Disneyland parks and picked this hotel because of location and price (we got it at $76 per night, directly from hotel website).  Arriving on the evening of Decemver 11th, check in was quick and simple, the reception staff didn't seem overly interested in us, just wanted to put us in a room.  I had emailed directly beforehand to request a high level floor, away from the elevators, with a view, if possible - as we were staying over my birthday and I was hoping to have a view of the Disney parks from our room. There was no mention of my requests at all, and they put us on level 3, in a room RIGHT next to the elevators, with a view of the building/carpark/hotel next door, completely

Summary: Have just stayed at this hotel with a family group of 5 Adults, staying in one room containing two queen beds and a pull out sofa. Can only say it is good value for money, being inexpensive for the 5 adults, well kept, clean and close to Disneyland. Can recommend this hotel to any family group wanting good value acccomodation within easy walking distance of Disneyland and food and shopping outlets. Did find the staff who checked us in not friendly at all, however on other occasions they were friendly when i asked some directions or other questions., although they were not the same staff who checked us in. Did not try the breakfast nor check out the gym or pool during our stay, so can't offer any comment on those facilities. Highly recommended.

Summary: My family and I stayed here for 6 nights and found the hotel clean and comfortable and we would definitely stay here again. Our room was large with comfortable beds and had a great view of the ferris wheel in California Adventure.   We found the front desk staff  very pleasant and helpful.  The hotel offers free internet and free parking which is a bonus.  The only minor complaint we had is that the breakfast buffet is very bland and could be improved on. To me this hotel is located in one of the most convenient locations in Anaheim.  Two blocks from the Garden Walk, a block from 7-11 (for pop/water/snacks), 1/2 a block from Subway/Chinese/Pizza/Mexican.. what more could you ask for?  The walk to Disneyland is 10-15 minutes at a leisurely pace or if you don't want to walk there

Summary: Pros: Large clean rooms. Close to Disney and Convention Center, free parking and internet Cons: Breakfast is a below average buffet for $8. Little to no service. Exercise room is small .

Summary: Top rate hotel.  The beds were great and we are picky sleepers.  I was really happy to have a massage shower-head after a long day at Disneyland.  I also like the black-out curtains and the quiet hallways so I could nap during the afternoon.  My adult children (22 and 25 yrs) were impressed with the hotel's free parking after visiting San Francisco earlier this month and having to pay to park $35 at their hotel.  The breakfast buffet served at the hotel restaurant was delicious and at great price of $8.  We were very close to Disneyland but make sure you print out a map so you can find it no matter what street you exit Disneyland.  We also were so grateful that they let us check-in earlier than suggested.  It was clean and the down-comforters were perfect, no matter what

Summary: I stay in Anaheim at least 3-4 times a year. This was my first stay at the Ramada Plaza.  We arrived around 8 AM on Sunday, and I didn't think we would be able to actually check in, but our room was ready. I had ART deliver tickets to the hotel, and the desk clerk handed me my tickets without even having to ask for them.   Over all I was extremely pleased with the Ramada Plaza. Check in was easy and the staff was extremely helpful. The room was clean and well appointed. I've never had such wonderful shower pressure at any hotel I have stayed at. The free parking is a plus, and if I had a laptop the free internet access would of been wonderful too.   The only down side were the beds were more firm than I'm use to, but I slept well. The ice machines didn't work very well... most

Summary Heading: If you're a light sleeper, don't stay here!
Summary: My husband, daughter, niece and I stayed here for one night on our trip through California.  The room was clean, but the air conditioning was so loud that it woke all of us repeatedly throughout the night, every time it came on to cool down the room.  I even got up at one point and changed the thermostat to a higher setting just so the a/c wouldn't come on and wake us up!   We were very tired the next day when we went to Disneyland.   That's why I gave this hotel an "average" rating instead of 'very good".
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest:  Thank you for bringing your dissatisfaction with our hotel to our attention. I am sure it must have been upsetting.   I apologize for the inconvenience we caused you and have brought your concerns to the attention to our Maintenance Department to prevent this type of incident.  Valued Guest , I would like to thank you for taking the time to let us know of your situation. Guest satisfaction is our top priority, and we appreciate it when our guests make the effort to bring to our attention items that need to be corrected. I am truly sorry about your experience, Valued Guest , and I assure you that this kind of incident is rare. If there is anything else we can assist you with please do not hesitate to call. We look forward to your future stay with us again.  Sincerely, Jane Bondoc                        Jane Bondoc General Manager

Summary: OMG!  This is the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in when visiting Disneyland.  I've even stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and the Ramada Plaza beats it by far.  The service is excellent and the hotel is gorgeous.  The lobby has many relaxing areas to hang out and rest and the restaurant has a great breakfast buffet for a small charge.  I highly recommend this hotel is you are visiting Dland.  We stayed for 6 nights and it was the best stay we ever had and we have been visiting for over ten years.  The hotel is a short walk from the park and it has a great pool and jacuzzi to help your feet and legs recover from all the walking.  Do yourself a favor and stay at this hotel you will feel pampered and special because it is so very nice.

Summary Heading: Pleasantly suprised by excellent customer service and great rates!
Summary: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights with my family during our Disneyland trip, and it definitely  serves as a great place to rest your feet after a long day at the park. Staff were awesome, and they gave us a room facing the park earlier than usual check-in time, and were always happy to make reservations and give directions at all hours. 7-11, cheap souvenir shop and AMAZING Garden Walk Mall ( a must see) just steps away. Mind you this is not the Hilton, and the room had some minor dents and bumps with some small carpet stains but was overall very satisfactory. Another negative was the pool area was rather small, but very well kept. This hotel is a great family hotel for Disney, and definitely kid-friendly.   (Also FREE WIFI in rooms and free computers and printer in the lobby).

Summary Heading: Finally, a room that works for our family of 5 at a reasonable rate!
Summary: It's a challenge to find a room that comfortably accomodates a family of 5 (who can afford two adjoining rooms?) but this room had 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa without being super cramped.  Biggest pleasant suprise - 5 full size plush towels in the bathroom (if you have a family of 5, I know you can relate to this!) The hotel seems almost new - everything sparkled.  Our room faced busy Katella Ave. but on the 4th floor with double windows, it was very quiet. The location is terrific, just 3 blocks or so from the main entrance to Disneyland and CA Adventure, and just up the street from the new Garden Walk with Cheesecake Factory, CA Pizza Kitchen, Bubba Gump's and several other places to eat.  We ate at the big, beautiful CCFactory and were quite pleased.  This is a big

Summary Heading: Great Place! Clean, Comfortable and not far from Disneyland!
Summary: This is a great hotel! I admit that the lack of recent reviews (along with some negative ones from the past) had me a bit worried, but the worries were unfounded. We were in the area for 5 nights in June to visit Disneyland. The hotel is located on Katella and is a short walk (10-15min depending on how fast you walk) from the park main entrance. The rate was very reasonable for peak season and was booked through the corporate website.  The hotel offers ample parking and what’s even better is most of it is in an underground garage keeping your car sheltered from the hot So Cal sun. They also offer (for a fee) an American breakfast buffet and also have a small gift shop and Indian restaurant on site. We never tried the restaurant or buffet while we visited though. The outdoor pool

Summary Heading: What a find, great value & a real welcome
Summary: I arrived early in Anaheim and my other Hotels had not allowed early check in, it was the most beautiful thing to hear the check in clerk say we have a room ready now for you as I had to leave my Las Vegas hotel at 3 am for the airport for my early flight. The staff here were always pleasant, helpful with booking needs for attractions, shuttle services etc. At check in I was automatically given my password for free wireless internet, the room was always spotless. I didn't use the restaurant (Indian, the food did smell great) it didn't spread through the hotel, my room was right above it room 221, the only down side I found was the airconditioning was very noisy. The pool area is very nice and I will reccommend it to friends visiting here in September 2009. Thankyou for a great

Summary: This hotel was very nice.  It was clean and about a block from Disneyland.  There is an ART bus stop right out front but it is close enough to walk.  The pool was very warm so we liked it.  Also had a hot tub and sauna.  The housekeeping service was a little slow but when we asked for towels it was not a problem.  No problems with check in or check out.  Staff was not so friendly but not rude either.  They have free parking in a garage which is locked at night so you can use your room key to go in and out, which was nice for the safety of your car.  There is an Indian restaurant on the first floor which smelled quite strong in the lobby area at lunch and dinner time but the smell did not carry up to our room on the 4th floor so that was good.  We would probably stay here again
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest:  Thank you for taking the time to share your comments on Trip Advisor regarding your stay with us at the Ramada Plaza Anaheim. Summary: It was recently remodeled, which was a plus. They wanted a $50 deposit in case of damages to the room during ur stay. I thought no big deal. However, long story short, did not remodel the air conditioning systems and blamed us for a leak. It was obvious there were previous water leaks before us. Additionally, manager told us there were plenty of other suites to switch to if we waited for it to work again in a couple hours, but at 3am in the morning, there was a 'sudden over booking' and they gave us an inferior room. they refused to call us back to help us, while water was leaking everywhere and there was backed up flowing water noises near the electric wires. how SCARY. we had to use an ice bucket to catch the water, and all they did was take the bucket out and turn it on to

Summary Heading: Great location.  Friendly Staff.  Will stay again
Summary: I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights with 2 friends. We chose this location because we wanted a place that was close to Disney Land and priced well.  I'm so glad we chose this location.  The staff was very friendly.  We stayed in a mini suite which had 2 beds and a pull out couch.  It also had a refrigerator and micowave.  The room was clean, the beds were pretty comfortable and I think it was perfect for 3 adults.  I think it would be a very tight fit for 6 adults, but for 3 it was great.  We needed an extra blanket so I called the front desk and they had someone bring one up right away.  We took the shuttle from the hotel to Dinsey Land.  It only cost $3 per person for the day.  The shuttle was great and we were to Disney Land in no time.  The driver was friendly and I'm so glad

The most important thing that made our stay very comfortable is that the staff are very helpful and friendly. Right when I came back to work I told all my co-workers that if they ever want to stay at Anaheim I will definitely recommend to stay at Ramada. Thank you for the good stay.

Summary: I booked this hotel via [--] best rate guarantee, and only had to pay $35 in hotel taxes for the 2 nights stay. I had flown in from NY and didn't get to the hotel till 3AM. I used it just as a base for Disneyland, since we were going to spend the whole day at Disneyland, sleep at the Ramada again, and leave early the next morning. Everything about the hotel was very nice. The rooms were big and comfortable. It was only a 15 minute walk to Disneyland, and there was a shuttle you could take outside the hotel (I think $1.50 or $2 each way) if you couldn't or didn't want to walk.   All in all I would definitely stay there again.  If anyone has any questions, please feel free to email me at yoshapman@hotmail.com

I was in no shape emotionally to venture outside on the grounds to have a cigarrete, and so we smoked by the open window in our room.  The staff mentioned it to us immediately and we were told we were subject to a $150.00 fine, then they all were very rude to us for the rest of our stay. Summary: I stayed for 2 nights and found the hotel to be a great value. I paid only $89 per night for a 2 bed double.  The positives are that the hotel is clean and the staff are all very pleasent and helpful. The lobby is nice and the rooms have a microwave and frig. Wireless internet is available and when it did go down I received a call from the front desk that it was back up.  The only problem I encountered was the iron and ironing board were bad.  But, they replaced them both without question.  The beds aren't the most comfortable but for $89 they are fine.  The carpets in the room and the sheets are not unlike a high volume hotel near a popular attraction. Summary: We spent 2 nights here in mid-September. We had a very nice room on the 4th floor. It was a Deluxe Family  room with 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa. There were 5 of us and it was not too cramped. The furnishings were new and clean, the bathroom was also very clean. We did not at anytime notice any wafting scents from the Indian restaurant downstairs. The desk staff were courteous and very helpful. The below ground parking was free and convenient.  We did use the pool and jacuzzi at non- traditional hours and had them nearly to ourselves. I imagine during the height of summer vacation season it could get quite crowded. Summary: We stayed in this hotel for three nights. After reading the reviews I was very weary of this hotel, but could not cancel becouse I used priceline. We got a very good deal , even better price than the super 8. The beds were very hard , as were the pillows, though my sister loved the firmness of her bed. The bathrooms were a nice size, but did not have a fan!! This means when you use the bathroom, the smell just fills the room. The water pressure was very weak and the hot water came and went.  Also, I am not 100% sure how this happened but after the first night in the bed I awoke with three bites on my leg. Summary Heading: You might get a good room, you might not.
Summary: Many different sizes of rooms, some very small.  However, even the smallest can apparently be called a mini-suite if that's what you've reserved or paid for.  The larger rooms are adequate, the smaller ones are not if you're travelling with a family.  The manager will attempt to convince you that all the rooms are the same; they aren't even close to the same in size.  Otherwise, the rooms are OK for the price, but tend to be noisy from adjoining and overhead rooms, air conditioning is noisy, and carpets will turn your feet black quickly in the way that hotel carpets that are vacuumed but rarely cleaned often do.  Pool is small and relatively shallow, basically good for kids only.  Location and parking are excellent.  Basically, if you get one of the larger rooms, it can be a

Summary: We're just your average, middle-class late 20s couple who wanted to go to Disneyland and stay at as good a hotel as possible on a limited budget. After a significant amount of research, we booked through Travelocity and were very, very pleasantly surprised. We had a double queen room, which was spacious, clean and--besides the beds and wall units--had a couch, desk and kitchenette. The room and lobby were very cozy, and we felt right at home. Staff were courteous, helpful and polite, and the overall atmosphere seemed much more sophisticated than I would have imagined for the price. An Indian restaurant is on-site, and open late. The pool, sauna and hot tub were also very clean (though the pool is somewhat small). The walk to Disneyland is about 3 long blocks...totally do-able,

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for...
Summary: We booked our stay at the Ramada Plaza in Anaheim via one of those on-line "name your price" deals and did indeed get a deal - about half off the regular rate, so I can't complain (much).  The staff was the best part of the stay - we arrived late (10:30pm) to find our room surrounded by partygoers and the hotel staff cheerfully moved us to another (very quiet) floor.  The room was a bit musty and be warned - these are the hardest hotel beds I have ever slept on - but all in all our two night stay was fine.  Good location (about a 10min. walk to the front gates of Disneyland).  There is a decent pizza place next to the hotel, as well as a Chinese fast food.  Denney's & IHop are walking distance too. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant, and although the scent of Indian food was

Summary Heading: Location good; otherwise it's a Ramada
Summary: Stayed here with our two kids for a visit to Disneyland. If you don’t mind walking it's about two long blocks from the park entrance. (Don't get this mixed up with the Maingate Ramada, which is directly across from the entrance.) Walk time is about 10 minutes. Walking is much faster than waiting for the tram. The location is very convenient.  Otherwise accommodations are what I would expect at a Ramada. Ok room, pretty clean, nothing fancy. As noted in some of the other reviews, this one has an Indian restaurant. Ordered takeout one night, which was a nice change from the Disney food we were eating the rest of the time. (5) Had a pool view, which was fine. Didn't get to use it 'coz we didn't have time; (6) Place was quiet, no noises heard next door or down the hall; (7) Underground parking a plus! Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 6 days/5 nights while taking our little ones to Disneyland.  The other TripAdvisor members who mentioned the hard beds were absolutely correct - we didn't wake up one morning without saying something to each other about an aching back.  The beds are pretty hard.  The room and facility were pretty clean, however the walls were thin.  You could hear most of what the loud-talking, rude neighbors were saying each morning.  Although the appearance was nice, the way the building was constructed looked like the contractors took every possible shortcut, and it appears as though they have a “handy-person” staff member do all of their own maintenance rather than using professionals. Like most people, I usually get my first impression upon walking into the lobby. This is a nice place. It's clean and in a great location if you're doing the whole Disney thing, being that it's right across the street from Disney's California Adventure.  It has gated underground parking, which is a first for me and I travel often.   I will kinda have to agree with some of the other posts regarding the hard beds. Summary Heading: Great Southern CA. vacation with the Ramada Plaza Anaheim Resort
Summary: We spent 6 nights at the Ramada Plaza Anaheim Resort this June-July and it couldn't have been money better spent.  We had booked a mini-suite for a last minute vacation for six people of all ages.  I have read the previous reviews regarding the beds, maybe they have replaced the beds.  But we all slept great!    All of the staff were very friendly.  One day the refrigerator went out.  We told the staff on our way out that day and  had a new refrigerator when we returned that evening.      I really liked the undergound parking.      I also liked the fact that it was a no-smoking hotel.  The hotel smelled clean.       Next time we'll try to get a room facing Disneyland so that we can see the fireworks.  But  it was nice watching them from the pool.      Because we had a  big

Summary Heading: Good clean hotel but horrible beds
Summary: We stayed at Ramada Plaza Hotel June 14th-18th. The Hotel itself and the grounds are very clean and attractive. The pool is very nice and the underground parking is a plus. One thing though they have a sign that says don't back up after you attempt to enter the parking garage because they have a fountain that sticks out into the parking lot behind you. I would take there advice because we saw a lady attempt to back out and she tore up her car when she backed into the fountain. It's a nice fountain but its location is obviously a problem so I wondered why they hadn't moved it. The location is convenient and very safe for a family. The staff is very freindly and helpful. Our shower control knob was broken one morning and they provided us another room to shower in and fixed ours

Summary: We stayed here for our annual convention at the convention center last year. We booked 5 months in advance so we got a really good deal on the room rate. We were delayed in checking in due to long lines at registration. I had to call the hotel and let them know we were checking in later than expected. They were very accomodating regarding this matter.  I liked the rooms, they were very clean but stuffy. The air conditioner took a while to cool the room down though and it was a little humid. The remote control for the TV had no batteries but since we mainly used the room to sleep after a hard day of running around it was acceptable.  I used the laundry room and it was very small. Only a couple of machines and I had to wait a bit to use them.  Parking was excellent since we were

Summary: We stayed at the Ramada Plaza this past March. The accomodations were fair and we got a great bargain on the rooms, but most of the front desk staff was rude and unprofessional. We checked in very late with Nadine, she was grumpy and groggy and appeared as if I woke her up! Some of the staff in the daytime was ok, but nothing as you would expect from a higher end hotel.

Summary: We recently stayed at the Ramada Plaza for 6 nights and were mostly pleased with our room except for the beds are very firm, almost to the point of being uncomfortable and there wasn't a lot of water pressure for the shower.  We were very pleased with the front desk staff and the cleaning staff.  Our room over looked the pool and had a great view of the Disneyland fireworks.  The advertisement said that it was a block from Disneyland, but it seemed a little further so on most days we chose to ride the shuttle which picks up righ outside the hotel.  Other than the beds and the shower pressure our stay at the Ramada was a pleasant one.

Summary: Our family stayed at the Ramada Plaza in November. We were greatly disappointed. (A handicap room is usually not necessary) I was told the room was a mini suite and very spacious. When we arrived I was certain they must have put us in the wrong room! The room was no larger than most standard rooms! In fact, we stayed at the HoJo in October and the standard room there was much more spacious than this "mini-suite". Looking at the beds, they truly looked like a double or full bed. Definetly not queen. I called the front desk to ask if there was a mistake, I was told no we were in a mini suite. Summary: The mattress was so hard I checked to see if it was made of concrete. The front desk was well aware of the hard mattress and just laughed. Customer service was like getting a root canal. The towels were old and discolored. The toilet paper was rough using leaves would of been softer. The sheets were ripped and the blankets had cigarette burns, even though they promote no smoking. The restaurant seats were stained badly I would wipe them off before sitting down as I was afraid of getting my clothes dirty.

Summary: my kids and i spent 3 nights at the ramada plaza. very clean, nice, new hotel. we've stayed at many hotels/motels in the area before. this one is a very good value for the price. we had a mini suite, about a 10 min walk from disneyland (there is a city shuttle available right on the corner for $3 per day per adult, kids are free). restaurants and a seven-eleven nearby. the pool looked nice but we never had any time to use it. we spent most of our time at disneyland and just wanted a safe clean place to stay. this hotel was everything i had hoped for. not a motel (like so many in the area). the only drawback was the exercise room. very small and extremely stuffy. who wants to work out without any air? over all a nice place and we will definately be back.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel over the July 4th weekend.  The hotel was nice & clean.  Parking was plentiful.  Some reviewers said this hotel was too far from Disneyland, we made the walk in less than 15 minutes several times.  Other times we used the shuttle.  Tickets may be purchased in the lobby.  We didn't need the staff at the desk much, but they were very helpful when we did.  The room was clean and had plenty of room.  We wanted an extra large room since we would be here for 5 days and the room we had was just what we asked for.  The only disappointments were that the pool was only 4' deep, and the day we wanted to use the hot tub, it was out of order.  The hot tub worked on the other days.  I wouldn't mind staying here if I ever return to California.

Summary Heading: A great place to stay for a Disney vacation
Summary: I stayed at this pleasent hotel for four nights in early December, 2003, and had a great time. The rooms were very spacious, and ultra clean. The lobby is also quite large and welcoming, with a cheery little Indian restaurant tucked in at the back. I only had breakfast at the restaurant, and though basic, it was very good food. As a solo traveller, I found the friendly, helpful staff to be most reassuring. The pool area was good size, and it was always nice to return to a warm spa after a long day in Disneyland. There was a minor incident which occured when the entire hotel lost power at around 7pm one night. Of course, this was totally beyond their control, but the staff were most professional in their actions to alert all the guests of the situation, and returned power within

Summary: After travelling through europe it was an absolute delight to stay at a hotel of such excellent standard. Staff were very friendly, the rooms were huge and the hotel was very close to Disneyland. We would spend the morning at the theme parks, come back for lunch and a swim at the pool, and then back to the parks for the afternoon. I will recommend this hotel to anyone who listens.

Summary Heading: Do not stay at this hotel!
Summary: We stayed at the anaheim plaza resort because we were told it was close to disneyland and the rates were good.  It is close but not close enough to walk and the shuttle service (city shuttle) was a little slow.  The room was nice but the walls are paper thin and you can hear EVERYTHING.  When you go out in the hallway at 7 am it sounds like there is a huge party going on.  The bed was very very uncomfortable.  We found out upon arrival that the resteraunt was closed because of new ownership and that would have been a deciding factor in whether we stayed at the hotel in the first place because we have an infant and cannot leave the hotel to eat at any given time. Summary: We stayed at the Ramada Plaza Anaheim in March of 2003 and found it to be a nice hotel.  It is located too far away from Disneyland to be an easy walk and its shuttle service is a bit rare.  The room was comfortable and well appointed.  The on site restaurant was very good for breakfast.  The swimming pool was laid out quite nice.  We were not going to Disneyland while we were they so we used the hotel as a place for us to drive down to the San Diego Zoo and Wild Animal Park.  We also wanted to do many other Southern California sites so the easy access to the freeways made the Ramada Plaza Anaheim a good place to stay.  Oh yes, the price was more than good.  They had an excellent off season rate for Canadians.
